42bool
43intel_ring_initialized(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
44{
45 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
46
47 if (!dev)
48 return false;
49
50 if (i915.enable_execlists) {
51 struct intel_context *dctx = ring->default_context;
52 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = dctx->engine[ring->id].ringbuf;
53
54 return ringbuf->obj;
55 } else
56 return ring->buffer && ring->buffer->obj;
57}
58
59int __intel_ring_space(int head, int tail, int size)
60{
61 int space = head - tail;
62 if (space <= 0)
63 space += size;
64 return space - I915_RING_FREE_SPACE;
65}
66
67void intel_ring_update_space(struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf)
68{
69 if (ringbuf->last_retired_head != -1) {
70 ringbuf->head = ringbuf->last_retired_head;
71 ringbuf->last_retired_head = -1;
72 }
73
74 ringbuf->space = __intel_ring_space(ringbuf->head & HEAD_ADDR,
75 ringbuf->tail, ringbuf->size);
76}
77
78int intel_ring_space(struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf)
79{
80 intel_ring_update_space(ringbuf);
81 return ringbuf->space;
82}
83
84bool intel_ring_stopped(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
85{
86 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
87 return dev_priv->gpu_error.stop_rings & intel_ring_flag(ring);
88}
89
90static void __intel_ring_advance(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
91{
92 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = ring->buffer;
93 ringbuf->tail &= ringbuf->size - 1;
94 if (intel_ring_stopped(ring))
95 return;
96 ring->write_tail(ring, ringbuf->tail);
97}
98
99static int
100gen2_render_ring_flush(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
101 u32 invalidate_domains,
102 u32 flush_domains)
103{
104 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
105 u32 cmd;
106 int ret;
107
108 cmd = MI_FLUSH;
109 if (((invalidate_domains|flush_domains) & I915_GEM_DOMAIN_RENDER) == 0)
110 cmd |= MI_NO_WRITE_FLUSH;
111
112 if (invalidate_domains & I915_GEM_DOMAIN_SAMPLER)
113 cmd |= MI_READ_FLUSH;
114
115 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 2);
116 if (ret)
117 return ret;
118
119 intel_ring_emit(ring, cmd);
120 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_NOOP);
121 intel_ring_advance(ring);
122
123 return 0;
124}
125
126static int
127gen4_render_ring_flush(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
128 u32 invalidate_domains,
129 u32 flush_domains)
130{
131 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
132 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
133 u32 cmd;
134 int ret;
135
136 /*
137 * read/write caches:
138 *
139 * I915_GEM_DOMAIN_RENDER is always invalidated, but is
140 * only flushed if MI_NO_WRITE_FLUSH is unset. On 965, it is
141 * also flushed at 2d versus 3d pipeline switches.
142 *
143 * read-only caches:
144 *
145 * I915_GEM_DOMAIN_SAMPLER is flushed on pre-965 if
146 * MI_READ_FLUSH is set, and is always flushed on 965.
147 *
148 * I915_GEM_DOMAIN_COMMAND may not exist?
149 *
150 * I915_GEM_DOMAIN_INSTRUCTION, which exists on 965, is
151 * invalidated when MI_EXE_FLUSH is set.
152 *
153 * I915_GEM_DOMAIN_VERTEX, which exists on 965, is
154 * invalidated with every MI_FLUSH.
155 *
156 * TLBs:
157 *
158 * On 965, TLBs associated with I915_GEM_DOMAIN_COMMAND
159 * and I915_GEM_DOMAIN_CPU in are invalidated at PTE write and
160 * I915_GEM_DOMAIN_RENDER and I915_GEM_DOMAIN_SAMPLER
161 * are flushed at any MI_FLUSH.
162 */
163
164 cmd = MI_FLUSH | MI_NO_WRITE_FLUSH;
165 if ((invalidate_domains|flush_domains) & I915_GEM_DOMAIN_RENDER)
166 cmd &= ~MI_NO_WRITE_FLUSH;
167 if (invalidate_domains & I915_GEM_DOMAIN_INSTRUCTION)
168 cmd |= MI_EXE_FLUSH;
169
170 if (invalidate_domains & I915_GEM_DOMAIN_COMMAND &&
171 (IS_G4X(dev) || IS_GEN5(dev)))
172 cmd |= MI_INVALIDATE_ISP;
173
174 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 2);
175 if (ret)
176 return ret;
177
178 intel_ring_emit(ring, cmd);
179 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_NOOP);
180 intel_ring_advance(ring);
181
182 return 0;
183}
184
185/**
186 * Emits a PIPE_CONTROL with a non-zero post-sync operation, for
187 * implementing two workarounds on gen6. From section 1.4.7.1
188 * "PIPE_CONTROL" of the Sandy Bridge PRM volume 2 part 1:
189 *
190 * [DevSNB-C+{W/A}] Before any depth stall flush (including those
191 * produced by non-pipelined state commands), software needs to first
192 * send a PIPE_CONTROL with no bits set except Post-Sync Operation !=
193 * 0.
194 *
195 * [Dev-SNB{W/A}]: Before a PIPE_CONTROL with Write Cache Flush Enable
196 * =1, a PIPE_CONTROL with any non-zero post-sync-op is required.
197 *
198 * And the workaround for these two requires this workaround first:
199 *
200 * [Dev-SNB{W/A}]: Pipe-control with CS-stall bit set must be sent
201 * BEFORE the pipe-control with a post-sync op and no write-cache
202 * flushes.
203 *
204 * And this last workaround is tricky because of the requirements on
205 * that bit. From section 1.4.7.2.3 "Stall" of the Sandy Bridge PRM
206 * volume 2 part 1:
207 *
208 * "1 of the following must also be set:
209 * - Render Target Cache Flush Enable ([12] of DW1)
210 * - Depth Cache Flush Enable ([0] of DW1)
211 * - Stall at Pixel Scoreboard ([1] of DW1)
212 * - Depth Stall ([13] of DW1)
213 * - Post-Sync Operation ([13] of DW1)
214 * - Notify Enable ([8] of DW1)"
215 *
216 * The cache flushes require the workaround flush that triggered this
217 * one, so we can't use it. Depth stall would trigger the same.
218 * Post-sync nonzero is what triggered this second workaround, so we
219 * can't use that one either. Notify enable is IRQs, which aren't
220 * really our business. That leaves only stall at scoreboard.
221 */
222static int
223intel_emit_post_sync_nonzero_flush(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
224{
225 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
226 u32 scratch_addr = ring->scratch.gtt_offset + 2 * CACHELINE_BYTES;
227 int ret;
228
229 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 6);
230 if (ret)
231 return ret;
232
233 intel_ring_emit(ring, GFX_OP_PIPE_CONTROL(5));
234 intel_ring_emit(ring, PIPE_CONTROL_CS_STALL |
235 PIPE_CONTROL_STALL_AT_SCOREBOARD);
236 intel_ring_emit(ring, scratch_addr | PIPE_CONTROL_GLOBAL_GTT); /* address */
237 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0); /* low dword */
238 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0); /* high dword */
239 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_NOOP);
240 intel_ring_advance(ring);
241
242 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 6);
243 if (ret)
244 return ret;
245
246 intel_ring_emit(ring, GFX_OP_PIPE_CONTROL(5));
247 intel_ring_emit(ring, PIPE_CONTROL_QW_WRITE);
248 intel_ring_emit(ring, scratch_addr | PIPE_CONTROL_GLOBAL_GTT); /* address */
249 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0);
250 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0);
251 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_NOOP);
252 intel_ring_advance(ring);
253
254 return 0;
255}
256
257static int
258gen6_render_ring_flush(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
259 u32 invalidate_domains, u32 flush_domains)
260{
261 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
262 u32 flags = 0;
263 u32 scratch_addr = ring->scratch.gtt_offset + 2 * CACHELINE_BYTES;
264 int ret;
265
266 /* Force SNB workarounds for PIPE_CONTROL flushes */
267 ret = intel_emit_post_sync_nonzero_flush(req);
268 if (ret)
269 return ret;
270
271 /* Just flush everything. Experiments have shown that reducing the
272 * number of bits based on the write domains has little performance
273 * impact.
274 */
275 if (flush_domains) {
276 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_RENDER_TARGET_CACHE_FLUSH;
277 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_DEPTH_CACHE_FLUSH;
278 /*
279 * Ensure that any following seqno writes only happen
280 * when the render cache is indeed flushed.
281 */
282 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_CS_STALL;
283 }
284 if (invalidate_domains) {
285 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_TLB_INVALIDATE;
286 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_INSTRUCTION_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
287 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_TEXTURE_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
288 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_VF_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
289 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_CONST_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
290 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_STATE_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
291 /*
292 * TLB invalidate requires a post-sync write.
293 */
294 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_QW_WRITE | PIPE_CONTROL_CS_STALL;
295 }
296
297 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 4);
298 if (ret)
299 return ret;
300
301 intel_ring_emit(ring, GFX_OP_PIPE_CONTROL(4));
302 intel_ring_emit(ring, flags);
303 intel_ring_emit(ring, scratch_addr | PIPE_CONTROL_GLOBAL_GTT);
304 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0);
305 intel_ring_advance(ring);
306
307 return 0;
308}
309
310static int
311gen7_render_ring_cs_stall_wa(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
312{
313 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
314 int ret;
315
316 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 4);
317 if (ret)
318 return ret;
319
320 intel_ring_emit(ring, GFX_OP_PIPE_CONTROL(4));
321 intel_ring_emit(ring, PIPE_CONTROL_CS_STALL |
322 PIPE_CONTROL_STALL_AT_SCOREBOARD);
323 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0);
324 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0);
325 intel_ring_advance(ring);
326
327 return 0;
328}
329
330static int
331gen7_render_ring_flush(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
332 u32 invalidate_domains, u32 flush_domains)
333{
334 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
335 u32 flags = 0;
336 u32 scratch_addr = ring->scratch.gtt_offset + 2 * CACHELINE_BYTES;
337 int ret;
338
339 /*
340 * Ensure that any following seqno writes only happen when the render
341 * cache is indeed flushed.
342 *
343 * Workaround: 4th PIPE_CONTROL command (except the ones with only
344 * read-cache invalidate bits set) must have the CS_STALL bit set. We
345 * don't try to be clever and just set it unconditionally.
346 */
347 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_CS_STALL;
348
349 /* Just flush everything. Experiments have shown that reducing the
350 * number of bits based on the write domains has little performance
351 * impact.
352 */
353 if (flush_domains) {
354 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_RENDER_TARGET_CACHE_FLUSH;
355 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_DEPTH_CACHE_FLUSH;
356 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_DC_FLUSH_ENABLE;
357 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_FLUSH_ENABLE;
358 }
359 if (invalidate_domains) {
360 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_TLB_INVALIDATE;
361 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_INSTRUCTION_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
362 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_TEXTURE_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
363 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_VF_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
364 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_CONST_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
365 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_STATE_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
366 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_MEDIA_STATE_CLEAR;
367 /*
368 * TLB invalidate requires a post-sync write.
369 */
370 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_QW_WRITE;
371 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_GLOBAL_GTT_IVB;
372
373 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_STALL_AT_SCOREBOARD;
374
375 /* Workaround: we must issue a pipe_control with CS-stall bit
376 * set before a pipe_control command that has the state cache
377 * invalidate bit set. */
378 gen7_render_ring_cs_stall_wa(req);
379 }
380
381 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 4);
382 if (ret)
383 return ret;
384
385 intel_ring_emit(ring, GFX_OP_PIPE_CONTROL(4));
386 intel_ring_emit(ring, flags);
387 intel_ring_emit(ring, scratch_addr);
388 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0);
389 intel_ring_advance(ring);
390
391 return 0;
392}
393
394static int
395gen8_emit_pipe_control(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
396 u32 flags, u32 scratch_addr)
397{
398 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
399 int ret;
400
401 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 6);
402 if (ret)
403 return ret;
404
405 intel_ring_emit(ring, GFX_OP_PIPE_CONTROL(6));
406 intel_ring_emit(ring, flags);
407 intel_ring_emit(ring, scratch_addr);
408 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0);
409 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0);
410 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0);
411 intel_ring_advance(ring);
412
413 return 0;
414}
415
416static int
417gen8_render_ring_flush(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
418 u32 invalidate_domains, u32 flush_domains)
419{
420 u32 flags = 0;
421 u32 scratch_addr = req->ring->scratch.gtt_offset + 2 * CACHELINE_BYTES;
422 int ret;
423
424 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_CS_STALL;
425
426 if (flush_domains) {
427 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_RENDER_TARGET_CACHE_FLUSH;
428 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_DEPTH_CACHE_FLUSH;
429 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_DC_FLUSH_ENABLE;
430 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_FLUSH_ENABLE;
431 }
432 if (invalidate_domains) {
433 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_TLB_INVALIDATE;
434 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_INSTRUCTION_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
435 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_TEXTURE_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
436 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_VF_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
437 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_CONST_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
438 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_STATE_CACHE_INVALIDATE;
439 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_QW_WRITE;
440 flags |= PIPE_CONTROL_GLOBAL_GTT_IVB;
441
442 /* WaCsStallBeforeStateCacheInvalidate:bdw,chv */
443 ret = gen8_emit_pipe_control(req,
444 PIPE_CONTROL_CS_STALL |
445 PIPE_CONTROL_STALL_AT_SCOREBOARD,
446 0);
447 if (ret)
448 return ret;
449 }
450
451 return gen8_emit_pipe_control(req, flags, scratch_addr);
452}
453
454static void ring_write_tail(struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
455 u32 value)
456{
457 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
458 I915_WRITE_TAIL(ring, value);
459}
460
461u64 intel_ring_get_active_head(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
462{
463 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
464 u64 acthd;
465
466 if (INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen >= 8)
467 acthd = I915_READ64_2x32(RING_ACTHD(ring->mmio_base),
468 RING_ACTHD_UDW(ring->mmio_base));
469 else if (INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen >= 4)
470 acthd = I915_READ(RING_ACTHD(ring->mmio_base));
471 else
472 acthd = I915_READ(ACTHD);
473
474 return acthd;
475}
476
477static void ring_setup_phys_status_page(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
478{
479 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
480 u32 addr;
481
482 addr = dev_priv->status_page_dmah->busaddr;
483 if (INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen >= 4)
484 addr |= (dev_priv->status_page_dmah->busaddr >> 28) & 0xf0;
485 I915_WRITE(HWS_PGA, addr);
486}
487
488static void intel_ring_setup_status_page(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
489{
490 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
491 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
492 u32 mmio = 0;
493
494 /* The ring status page addresses are no longer next to the rest of
495 * the ring registers as of gen7.
496 */
497 if (IS_GEN7(dev)) {
498 switch (ring->id) {
499 case RCS:
500 mmio = RENDER_HWS_PGA_GEN7;
501 break;
502 case BCS:
503 mmio = BLT_HWS_PGA_GEN7;
504 break;
505 /*
506 * VCS2 actually doesn't exist on Gen7. Only shut up
507 * gcc switch check warning
508 */
509 case VCS2:
510 case VCS:
511 mmio = BSD_HWS_PGA_GEN7;
512 break;
513 case VECS:
514 mmio = VEBOX_HWS_PGA_GEN7;
515 break;
516 }
517 } else if (IS_GEN6(ring->dev)) {
518 mmio = RING_HWS_PGA_GEN6(ring->mmio_base);
519 } else {
520 /* XXX: gen8 returns to sanity */
521 mmio = RING_HWS_PGA(ring->mmio_base);
522 }
523
524 I915_WRITE(mmio, (u32)ring->status_page.gfx_addr);
525 POSTING_READ(mmio);
526
527 /*
528 * Flush the TLB for this page
529 *
530 * FIXME: These two bits have disappeared on gen8, so a question
531 * arises: do we still need this and if so how should we go about
532 * invalidating the TLB?
533 */
534 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 6 && INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen < 8) {
535 u32 reg = RING_INSTPM(ring->mmio_base);
536
537 /* ring should be idle before issuing a sync flush*/
538 WARN_ON((I915_READ_MODE(ring) & MODE_IDLE) == 0);
539
540 I915_WRITE(reg,
541 _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(INSTPM_TLB_INVALIDATE |
542 INSTPM_SYNC_FLUSH));
543 if (wait_for((I915_READ(reg) & INSTPM_SYNC_FLUSH) == 0,
544 1000))
545 DRM_ERROR("%s: wait for SyncFlush to complete for TLB invalidation timed out\n",
546 ring->name);
547 }
548}
549
550static bool stop_ring(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
551{
552 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = to_i915(ring->dev);
553
554 if (!IS_GEN2(ring->dev)) {
555 I915_WRITE_MODE(ring, _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(STOP_RING));
556 if (wait_for((I915_READ_MODE(ring) & MODE_IDLE) != 0, 1000)) {
557 DRM_ERROR("%s : timed out trying to stop ring\n", ring->name);
558 /* Sometimes we observe that the idle flag is not
559 * set even though the ring is empty. So double
560 * check before giving up.
561 */
562 if (I915_READ_HEAD(ring) != I915_READ_TAIL(ring))
563 return false;
564 }
565 }
566
567 I915_WRITE_CTL(ring, 0);
568 I915_WRITE_HEAD(ring, 0);
569 ring->write_tail(ring, 0);
570
571 if (!IS_GEN2(ring->dev)) {
572 (void)I915_READ_CTL(ring);
573 I915_WRITE_MODE(ring, _MASKED_BIT_DISABLE(STOP_RING));
574 }
575
576 return (I915_READ_HEAD(ring) & HEAD_ADDR) == 0;
577}
578
579static int init_ring_common(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
580{
581 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
582 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
583 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = ring->buffer;
584 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = ringbuf->obj;
585 int ret = 0;
586
587 intel_uncore_forcewake_get(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_ALL);
588
589 if (!stop_ring(ring)) {
590 /* G45 ring initialization often fails to reset head to zero */
591 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("%s head not reset to zero "
592 "ctl %08x head %08x tail %08x start %08x\n",
593 ring->name,
594 I915_READ_CTL(ring),
595 I915_READ_HEAD(ring),
596 I915_READ_TAIL(ring),
597 I915_READ_START(ring));
598
599 if (!stop_ring(ring)) {
600 DRM_ERROR("failed to set %s head to zero "
601 "ctl %08x head %08x tail %08x start %08x\n",
602 ring->name,
603 I915_READ_CTL(ring),
604 I915_READ_HEAD(ring),
605 I915_READ_TAIL(ring),
606 I915_READ_START(ring));
607 ret = -EIO;
608 goto out;
609 }
610 }
611
612 if (I915_NEED_GFX_HWS(dev))
613 intel_ring_setup_status_page(ring);
614 else
615 ring_setup_phys_status_page(ring);
616
617 /* Enforce ordering by reading HEAD register back */
618 I915_READ_HEAD(ring);
619
620 /* Initialize the ring. This must happen _after_ we've cleared the ring
621 * registers with the above sequence (the readback of the HEAD registers
622 * also enforces ordering), otherwise the hw might lose the new ring
623 * register values. */
624 I915_WRITE_START(ring, i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj));
625
626 /* WaClearRingBufHeadRegAtInit:ctg,elk */
627 if (I915_READ_HEAD(ring))
628 DRM_DEBUG("%s initialization failed [head=%08x], fudging\n",
629 ring->name, I915_READ_HEAD(ring));
630 I915_WRITE_HEAD(ring, 0);
631 (void)I915_READ_HEAD(ring);
632
633 I915_WRITE_CTL(ring,
634 ((ringbuf->size - PAGE_SIZE) & RING_NR_PAGES)
635 | RING_VALID);
636
637 /* If the head is still not zero, the ring is dead */
638 if (wait_for((I915_READ_CTL(ring) & RING_VALID) != 0 &&
639 I915_READ_START(ring) == i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj) &&
640 (I915_READ_HEAD(ring) & HEAD_ADDR) == 0, 50)) {
641 DRM_ERROR("%s initialization failed "
642 "ctl %08x (valid? %d) head %08x tail %08x start %08x [expected %08lx]\n",
643 ring->name,
644 I915_READ_CTL(ring), I915_READ_CTL(ring) & RING_VALID,
645 I915_READ_HEAD(ring), I915_READ_TAIL(ring),
646 I915_READ_START(ring), (unsigned long)i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj));
647 ret = -EIO;
648 goto out;
649 }
650
651 ringbuf->last_retired_head = -1;
652 ringbuf->head = I915_READ_HEAD(ring);
653 ringbuf->tail = I915_READ_TAIL(ring) & TAIL_ADDR;
654 intel_ring_update_space(ringbuf);
655
656 memset(&ring->hangcheck, 0, sizeof(ring->hangcheck));
657
658out:
659 intel_uncore_forcewake_put(dev_priv, FORCEWAKE_ALL);
660
661 return ret;
662}
663
664void
665intel_fini_pipe_control(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
666{
667 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
668
669 if (ring->scratch.obj == NULL)
670 return;
671
672 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 5) {
673#ifdef __NetBSD__
674 kunmap(container_of(TAILQ_FIRST(&ring->scratch.obj->pageq),
675 struct page, p_vmp));
676#else
677 kunmap(sg_page(ring->scratch.obj->pages->sgl));
678#endif
679 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(ring->scratch.obj);
680 }
681
682 drm_gem_object_unreference(&ring->scratch.obj->base);
683 ring->scratch.obj = NULL;
684}
685
686int
687intel_init_pipe_control(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
688{
689 int ret;
690
691 WARN_ON(ring->scratch.obj);
692
693 ring->scratch.obj = i915_gem_alloc_object(ring->dev, 4096);
694 if (ring->scratch.obj == NULL) {
695 DRM_ERROR("Failed to allocate seqno page\n");
696 ret = -ENOMEM;
697 goto err;
698 }
699
700 ret = i915_gem_object_set_cache_level(ring->scratch.obj, I915_CACHE_LLC);
701 if (ret)
702 goto err_unref;
703
704 ret = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_pin(ring->scratch.obj, 4096, 0);
705 if (ret)
706 goto err_unref;
707
708 ring->scratch.gtt_offset = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(ring->scratch.obj);
709#ifdef __NetBSD__
710 ring->scratch.cpu_page =
711 kmap(container_of(TAILQ_FIRST(&ring->scratch.obj->pageq),
712 struct page, p_vmp));
713#else
714 ring->scratch.cpu_page = kmap(sg_page(ring->scratch.obj->pages->sgl));
715#endif
716 if (ring->scratch.cpu_page == NULL) {
717 ret = -ENOMEM;
718 goto err_unpin;
719 }
720
721 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("%s pipe control offset: 0x%08x\n",
722 ring->name, ring->scratch.gtt_offset);
723 return 0;
724
725err_unpin:
726 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(ring->scratch.obj);
727err_unref:
728 drm_gem_object_unreference(&ring->scratch.obj->base);
729err:
730 return ret;
731}
732
733static int intel_ring_workarounds_emit(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
734{
735 int ret, i;
736 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
737 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
738 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
739 struct i915_workarounds *w = &dev_priv->workarounds;
740
741 if (w->count == 0)
742 return 0;
743
744 ring->gpu_caches_dirty = true;
745 ret = intel_ring_flush_all_caches(req);
746 if (ret)
747 return ret;
748
749 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, (w->count * 2 + 2));
750 if (ret)
751 return ret;
752
753 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(w->count));
754 for (i = 0; i < w->count; i++) {
755 intel_ring_emit(ring, w->reg[i].addr);
756 intel_ring_emit(ring, w->reg[i].value);
757 }
758 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_NOOP);
759
760 intel_ring_advance(ring);
761
762 ring->gpu_caches_dirty = true;
763 ret = intel_ring_flush_all_caches(req);
764 if (ret)
765 return ret;
766
767 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Number of Workarounds emitted: %d\n", w->count);
768
769 return 0;
770}
771
772static int intel_rcs_ctx_init(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
773{
774 int ret;
775
776 ret = intel_ring_workarounds_emit(req);
777 if (ret != 0)
778 return ret;
779
780 ret = i915_gem_render_state_init(req);
781 if (ret)
782 DRM_ERROR("init render state: %d\n", ret);
783
784 return ret;
785}
786
787static int wa_add(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
788 const u32 addr, const u32 mask, const u32 val)
789{
790 const u32 idx = dev_priv->workarounds.count;
791
792 if (WARN_ON(idx >= I915_MAX_WA_REGS))
793 return -ENOSPC;
794
795 dev_priv->workarounds.reg[idx].addr = addr;
796 dev_priv->workarounds.reg[idx].value = val;
797 dev_priv->workarounds.reg[idx].mask = mask;
798
799 dev_priv->workarounds.count++;
800
801 return 0;
802}
803
804#define WA_REG(addr, mask, val) do { \
805 const int r = wa_add(dev_priv, (addr), (mask), (val)); \
806 if (r) \
807 return r; \
808 } while (0)
809
810#define WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(addr, mask) \
811 WA_REG(addr, (mask), _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(mask))
812
813#define WA_CLR_BIT_MASKED(addr, mask) \
814 WA_REG(addr, (mask), _MASKED_BIT_DISABLE(mask))
815
816#define WA_SET_FIELD_MASKED(addr, mask, value) \
817 WA_REG(addr, mask, _MASKED_FIELD(mask, value))
818
819#define WA_SET_BIT(addr, mask) WA_REG(addr, mask, I915_READ(addr) | (mask))
820#define WA_CLR_BIT(addr, mask) WA_REG(addr, mask, I915_READ(addr) & ~(mask))
821
822#define WA_WRITE(addr, val) WA_REG(addr, 0xffffffff, val)
823
824static int gen8_init_workarounds(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
825{
826 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
827 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
828
829 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(INSTPM, INSTPM_FORCE_ORDERING);
830
831 /* WaDisableAsyncFlipPerfMode:bdw,chv */
832 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(MI_MODE, ASYNC_FLIP_PERF_DISABLE);
833
834 /* WaDisablePartialInstShootdown:bdw,chv */
835 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(GEN8_ROW_CHICKEN,
836 PARTIAL_INSTRUCTION_SHOOTDOWN_DISABLE);
837
838 /* Use Force Non-Coherent whenever executing a 3D context. This is a
839 * workaround for for a possible hang in the unlikely event a TLB
840 * invalidation occurs during a PSD flush.
841 */
842 /* WaForceEnableNonCoherent:bdw,chv */
843 /* WaHdcDisableFetchWhenMasked:bdw,chv */
844 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(HDC_CHICKEN0,
845 HDC_DONOT_FETCH_MEM_WHEN_MASKED |
846 HDC_FORCE_NON_COHERENT);
847
848 /* From the Haswell PRM, Command Reference: Registers, CACHE_MODE_0:
849 * "The Hierarchical Z RAW Stall Optimization allows non-overlapping
850 * polygons in the same 8x4 pixel/sample area to be processed without
851 * stalling waiting for the earlier ones to write to Hierarchical Z
852 * buffer."
853 *
854 * This optimization is off by default for BDW and CHV; turn it on.
855 */
856 WA_CLR_BIT_MASKED(CACHE_MODE_0_GEN7, HIZ_RAW_STALL_OPT_DISABLE);
857
858 /* Wa4x4STCOptimizationDisable:bdw,chv */
859 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(CACHE_MODE_1, GEN8_4x4_STC_OPTIMIZATION_DISABLE);
860
861 /*
862 * BSpec recommends 8x4 when MSAA is used,
863 * however in practice 16x4 seems fastest.
864 *
865 * Note that PS/WM thread counts depend on the WIZ hashing
866 * disable bit, which we don't touch here, but it's good
867 * to keep in mind (see 3DSTATE_PS and 3DSTATE_WM).
868 */
869 WA_SET_FIELD_MASKED(GEN7_GT_MODE,
870 GEN6_WIZ_HASHING_MASK,
871 GEN6_WIZ_HASHING_16x4);
872
873 return 0;
874}
875
876static int bdw_init_workarounds(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
877{
878 int ret;
879 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
880 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
881
882 ret = gen8_init_workarounds(ring);
883 if (ret)
884 return ret;
885
886 /* WaDisableThreadStallDopClockGating:bdw (pre-production) */
887 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(GEN8_ROW_CHICKEN, STALL_DOP_GATING_DISABLE);
888
889 /* WaDisableDopClockGating:bdw */
890 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(GEN7_ROW_CHICKEN2,
891 DOP_CLOCK_GATING_DISABLE);
892
893 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(HALF_SLICE_CHICKEN3,
894 GEN8_SAMPLER_POWER_BYPASS_DIS);
895
896 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(HDC_CHICKEN0,
897 /* WaForceContextSaveRestoreNonCoherent:bdw */
898 HDC_FORCE_CONTEXT_SAVE_RESTORE_NON_COHERENT |
899 /* WaDisableFenceDestinationToSLM:bdw (pre-prod) */
900 (IS_BDW_GT3(dev) ? HDC_FENCE_DEST_SLM_DISABLE : 0));
901
902 return 0;
903}
904
905static int chv_init_workarounds(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
906{
907 int ret;
908 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
909 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
910
911 ret = gen8_init_workarounds(ring);
912 if (ret)
913 return ret;
914
915 /* WaDisableThreadStallDopClockGating:chv */
916 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(GEN8_ROW_CHICKEN, STALL_DOP_GATING_DISABLE);
917
918 /* Improve HiZ throughput on CHV. */
919 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(HIZ_CHICKEN, CHV_HZ_8X8_MODE_IN_1X);
920
921 return 0;
922}
923
924static int gen9_init_workarounds(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
925{
926 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
927 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
928 uint32_t tmp;
929
930 /* WaEnableLbsSlaRetryTimerDecrement:skl */
931 I915_WRITE(BDW_SCRATCH1, I915_READ(BDW_SCRATCH1) |
932 GEN9_LBS_SLA_RETRY_TIMER_DECREMENT_ENABLE);
933
934 /* WaDisableKillLogic:bxt,skl */
935 I915_WRITE(GAM_ECOCHK, I915_READ(GAM_ECOCHK) |
936 ECOCHK_DIS_TLB);
937
938 /* WaDisablePartialInstShootdown:skl,bxt */
939 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(GEN8_ROW_CHICKEN,
940 PARTIAL_INSTRUCTION_SHOOTDOWN_DISABLE);
941
942 /* Syncing dependencies between camera and graphics:skl,bxt */
943 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(HALF_SLICE_CHICKEN3,
944 GEN9_DISABLE_OCL_OOB_SUPPRESS_LOGIC);
945
946 if ((IS_SKYLAKE(dev) && (INTEL_REVID(dev) == SKL_REVID_A0 ||
947 INTEL_REVID(dev) == SKL_REVID_B0)) ||
948 (IS_BROXTON(dev) && INTEL_REVID(dev) < BXT_REVID_B0)) {
949 /* WaDisableDgMirrorFixInHalfSliceChicken5:skl,bxt */
950 WA_CLR_BIT_MASKED(GEN9_HALF_SLICE_CHICKEN5,
951 GEN9_DG_MIRROR_FIX_ENABLE);
952 }
953
954 if ((IS_SKYLAKE(dev) && INTEL_REVID(dev) <= SKL_REVID_B0) ||
955 (IS_BROXTON(dev) && INTEL_REVID(dev) < BXT_REVID_B0)) {
956 /* WaSetDisablePixMaskCammingAndRhwoInCommonSliceChicken:skl,bxt */
957 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(GEN7_COMMON_SLICE_CHICKEN1,
958 GEN9_RHWO_OPTIMIZATION_DISABLE);
959 /*
960 * WA also requires GEN9_SLICE_COMMON_ECO_CHICKEN0[14:14] to be set
961 * but we do that in per ctx batchbuffer as there is an issue
962 * with this register not getting restored on ctx restore
963 */
964 }
965
966 if ((IS_SKYLAKE(dev) && INTEL_REVID(dev) >= SKL_REVID_C0) ||
967 IS_BROXTON(dev)) {
968 /* WaEnableYV12BugFixInHalfSliceChicken7:skl,bxt */
969 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(GEN9_HALF_SLICE_CHICKEN7,
970 GEN9_ENABLE_YV12_BUGFIX);
971 }
972
973 /* Wa4x4STCOptimizationDisable:skl,bxt */
974 /* WaDisablePartialResolveInVc:skl,bxt */
975 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(CACHE_MODE_1, (GEN8_4x4_STC_OPTIMIZATION_DISABLE |
976 GEN9_PARTIAL_RESOLVE_IN_VC_DISABLE));
977
978 /* WaCcsTlbPrefetchDisable:skl,bxt */
979 WA_CLR_BIT_MASKED(GEN9_HALF_SLICE_CHICKEN5,
980 GEN9_CCS_TLB_PREFETCH_ENABLE);
981
982 /* WaDisableMaskBasedCammingInRCC:skl,bxt */
983 if ((IS_SKYLAKE(dev) && INTEL_REVID(dev) == SKL_REVID_C0) ||
984 (IS_BROXTON(dev) && INTEL_REVID(dev) < BXT_REVID_B0))
985 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(SLICE_ECO_CHICKEN0,
986 PIXEL_MASK_CAMMING_DISABLE);
987
988 /* WaForceContextSaveRestoreNonCoherent:skl,bxt */
989 tmp = HDC_FORCE_CONTEXT_SAVE_RESTORE_NON_COHERENT;
990 if ((IS_SKYLAKE(dev) && INTEL_REVID(dev) == SKL_REVID_F0) ||
991 (IS_BROXTON(dev) && INTEL_REVID(dev) >= BXT_REVID_B0))
992 tmp |= HDC_FORCE_CSR_NON_COHERENT_OVR_DISABLE;
993 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(HDC_CHICKEN0, tmp);
994
995 /* WaDisableSamplerPowerBypassForSOPingPong:skl,bxt */
996 if (IS_SKYLAKE(dev) || IS_KABYLAKE(dev) ||
997 (IS_BROXTON(dev) && INTEL_REVID(dev) <= BXT_REVID_B0)) {
998 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(HALF_SLICE_CHICKEN3,
999 GEN8_SAMPLER_POWER_BYPASS_DIS);
1000 }
1001
1002 /* WaDisableSTUnitPowerOptimization:skl,bxt */
1003 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(HALF_SLICE_CHICKEN2, GEN8_ST_PO_DISABLE);
1004
1005 return 0;
1006}
1007
1008static int skl_tune_iz_hashing(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1009{
1010 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1011 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1012 u8 vals[3] = { 0, 0, 0 };
1013 unsigned int i;
1014
1015 for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
1016 u8 ss;
1017
1018 /*
1019 * Only consider slices where one, and only one, subslice has 7
1020 * EUs
1021 */
1022 if (hweight8(dev_priv->info.subslice_7eu[i]) != 1)
1023 continue;
1024
1025 /*
1026 * subslice_7eu[i] != 0 (because of the check above) and
1027 * ss_max == 4 (maximum number of subslices possible per slice)
1028 *
1029 * -> 0 <= ss <= 3;
1030 */
1031 ss = ffs(dev_priv->info.subslice_7eu[i]) - 1;
1032 vals[i] = 3 - ss;
1033 }
1034
1035 if (vals[0] == 0 && vals[1] == 0 && vals[2] == 0)
1036 return 0;
1037
1038 /* Tune IZ hashing. See intel_device_info_runtime_init() */
1039 WA_SET_FIELD_MASKED(GEN7_GT_MODE,
1040 GEN9_IZ_HASHING_MASK(2) |
1041 GEN9_IZ_HASHING_MASK(1) |
1042 GEN9_IZ_HASHING_MASK(0),
1043 GEN9_IZ_HASHING(2, vals[2]) |
1044 GEN9_IZ_HASHING(1, vals[1]) |
1045 GEN9_IZ_HASHING(0, vals[0]));
1046
1047 return 0;
1048}
1049
1050static int skl_init_workarounds(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1051{
1052 int ret;
1053 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1054 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1055
1056 ret = gen9_init_workarounds(ring);
1057 if (ret)
1058 return ret;
1059
1060 if (INTEL_REVID(dev) <= SKL_REVID_D0) {
1061 /* WaDisableHDCInvalidation:skl */
1062 I915_WRITE(GAM_ECOCHK, I915_READ(GAM_ECOCHK) |
1063 BDW_DISABLE_HDC_INVALIDATION);
1064
1065 /* WaDisableChickenBitTSGBarrierAckForFFSliceCS:skl */
1066 I915_WRITE(FF_SLICE_CS_CHICKEN2,
1067 _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(GEN9_TSG_BARRIER_ACK_DISABLE));
1068 }
1069
1070 /* GEN8_L3SQCREG4 has a dependency with WA batch so any new changes
1071 * involving this register should also be added to WA batch as required.
1072 */
1073 if (INTEL_REVID(dev) <= SKL_REVID_E0)
1074 /* WaDisableLSQCROPERFforOCL:skl */
1075 I915_WRITE(GEN8_L3SQCREG4, I915_READ(GEN8_L3SQCREG4) |
1076 GEN8_LQSC_RO_PERF_DIS);
1077
1078 /* WaEnableGapsTsvCreditFix:skl */
1079 if (IS_SKYLAKE(dev) && (INTEL_REVID(dev) >= SKL_REVID_C0)) {
1080 I915_WRITE(GEN8_GARBCNTL, (I915_READ(GEN8_GARBCNTL) |
1081 GEN9_GAPS_TSV_CREDIT_DISABLE));
1082 }
1083
1084 /* WaDisablePowerCompilerClockGating:skl */
1085 if (INTEL_REVID(dev) == SKL_REVID_B0)
1086 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(HIZ_CHICKEN,
1087 BDW_HIZ_POWER_COMPILER_CLOCK_GATING_DISABLE);
1088
1089 if (INTEL_REVID(dev) <= SKL_REVID_D0) {
1090 /*
1091 *Use Force Non-Coherent whenever executing a 3D context. This
1092 * is a workaround for a possible hang in the unlikely event
1093 * a TLB invalidation occurs during a PSD flush.
1094 */
1095 /* WaForceEnableNonCoherent:skl */
1096 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(HDC_CHICKEN0,
1097 HDC_FORCE_NON_COHERENT);
1098 }
1099
1100 if (INTEL_REVID(dev) == SKL_REVID_C0 ||
1101 INTEL_REVID(dev) == SKL_REVID_D0)
1102 /* WaBarrierPerformanceFixDisable:skl */
1103 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(HDC_CHICKEN0,
1104 HDC_FENCE_DEST_SLM_DISABLE |
1105 HDC_BARRIER_PERFORMANCE_DISABLE);
1106
1107 /* WaDisableSbeCacheDispatchPortSharing:skl */
1108 if (INTEL_REVID(dev) <= SKL_REVID_F0) {
1109 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(
1110 GEN7_HALF_SLICE_CHICKEN1,
1111 GEN7_SBE_SS_CACHE_DISPATCH_PORT_SHARING_DISABLE);
1112 }
1113
1114 return skl_tune_iz_hashing(ring);
1115}
1116
1117static int bxt_init_workarounds(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1118{
1119 int ret;
1120 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1121 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1122
1123 ret = gen9_init_workarounds(ring);
1124 if (ret)
1125 return ret;
1126
1127 /* WaStoreMultiplePTEenable:bxt */
1128 /* This is a requirement according to Hardware specification */
1129 if (INTEL_REVID(dev) == BXT_REVID_A0)
1130 I915_WRITE(TILECTL, I915_READ(TILECTL) | TILECTL_TLBPF);
1131
1132 /* WaSetClckGatingDisableMedia:bxt */
1133 if (INTEL_REVID(dev) == BXT_REVID_A0) {
1134 I915_WRITE(GEN7_MISCCPCTL, (I915_READ(GEN7_MISCCPCTL) &
1135 ~GEN8_DOP_CLOCK_GATE_MEDIA_ENABLE));
1136 }
1137
1138 /* WaDisableThreadStallDopClockGating:bxt */
1139 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(GEN8_ROW_CHICKEN,
1140 STALL_DOP_GATING_DISABLE);
1141
1142 /* WaDisableSbeCacheDispatchPortSharing:bxt */
1143 if (INTEL_REVID(dev) <= BXT_REVID_B0) {
1144 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(
1145 GEN7_HALF_SLICE_CHICKEN1,
1146 GEN7_SBE_SS_CACHE_DISPATCH_PORT_SHARING_DISABLE);
1147 }
1148
1149 return 0;
1150}
1151
1152static int kbl_init_workarounds(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1153{
1154 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1155 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1156 int ret;
1157
1158 ret = gen9_init_workarounds(ring);
1159 if (ret)
1160 return ret;
1161
1162 /* WaEnableGapsTsvCreditFix:kbl */
1163 I915_WRITE(GEN8_GARBCNTL, (I915_READ(GEN8_GARBCNTL) |
1164 GEN9_GAPS_TSV_CREDIT_DISABLE));
1165
1166 /* WaDisableDynamicCreditSharing:kbl */
1167 if (IS_KBL_REVID(dev_priv, 0, KBL_REVID_B0))
1168 WA_SET_BIT(GAMT_CHKN_BIT_REG,
1169 GAMT_CHKN_DISABLE_DYNAMIC_CREDIT_SHARING);
1170
1171 /* WaDisableFenceDestinationToSLM:kbl (pre-prod) */
1172 if (IS_KBL_REVID(dev_priv, KBL_REVID_A0, KBL_REVID_A0))
1173 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(HDC_CHICKEN0,
1174 HDC_FENCE_DEST_SLM_DISABLE);
1175
1176 /* GEN8_L3SQCREG4 has a dependency with WA batch so any new changes
1177 * involving this register should also be added to WA batch as required.
1178 */
1179 if (IS_KBL_REVID(dev_priv, 0, KBL_REVID_E0))
1180 /* WaDisableLSQCROPERFforOCL:kbl */
1181 I915_WRITE(GEN8_L3SQCREG4, I915_READ(GEN8_L3SQCREG4) |
1182 GEN8_LQSC_RO_PERF_DIS);
1183
1184 /* WaToEnableHwFixForPushConstHWBug:kbl */
1185 if (IS_KBL_REVID(dev_priv, KBL_REVID_C0, REVID_FOREVER))
1186 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(COMMON_SLICE_CHICKEN2,
1187 GEN8_SBE_DISABLE_REPLAY_BUF_OPTIMIZATION);
1188
1189 /* WaDisableGafsUnitClkGating:kbl */
1190 WA_SET_BIT(GEN7_UCGCTL4, GEN8_EU_GAUNIT_CLOCK_GATE_DISABLE);
1191
1192 /* WaDisableSbeCacheDispatchPortSharing:kbl */
1193 WA_SET_BIT_MASKED(
1194 GEN7_HALF_SLICE_CHICKEN1,
1195 GEN7_SBE_SS_CACHE_DISPATCH_PORT_SHARING_DISABLE);
1196
1197 /* WaInPlaceDecompressionHang:kbl */
1198 WA_SET_BIT(GEN9_GAMT_ECO_REG_RW_IA,
1199 GAMT_ECO_ENABLE_IN_PLACE_DECOMPRESS);
1200
1201#ifdef notyet
1202 /* WaDisableLSQCROPERFforOCL:kbl */
1203 ret = wa_ring_whitelist_reg(engine, GEN8_L3SQCREG4);
1204 if (ret)
1205 return ret;
1206#endif
1207
1208 return 0;
1209}
1210
1211int init_workarounds_ring(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1212{
1213 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1214 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1215
1216 WARN_ON(ring->id != RCS);
1217
1218 dev_priv->workarounds.count = 0;
1219
1220 if (IS_BROADWELL(dev))
1221 return bdw_init_workarounds(ring);
1222
1223 if (IS_CHERRYVIEW(dev))
1224 return chv_init_workarounds(ring);
1225
1226 if (IS_SKYLAKE(dev))
1227 return skl_init_workarounds(ring);
1228
1229 if (IS_BROXTON(dev))
1230 return bxt_init_workarounds(ring);
1231
1232 if (IS_KABYLAKE(dev))
1233 return kbl_init_workarounds(ring);
1234
1235 return 0;
1236}
1237
1238static int init_render_ring(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1239{
1240 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1241 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1242 int ret = init_ring_common(ring);
1243 if (ret)
1244 return ret;
1245
1246 /* WaTimedSingleVertexDispatch:cl,bw,ctg,elk,ilk,snb */
1247 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 4 && INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen < 7)
1248 I915_WRITE(MI_MODE, _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(VS_TIMER_DISPATCH));
1249
1250 /* We need to disable the AsyncFlip performance optimisations in order
1251 * to use MI_WAIT_FOR_EVENT within the CS. It should already be
1252 * programmed to '1' on all products.
1253 *
1254 * WaDisableAsyncFlipPerfMode:snb,ivb,hsw,vlv
1255 */
1256 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 6 && INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen < 8)
1257 I915_WRITE(MI_MODE, _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(ASYNC_FLIP_PERF_DISABLE));
1258
1259 /* Required for the hardware to program scanline values for waiting */
1260 /* WaEnableFlushTlbInvalidationMode:snb */
1261 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen == 6)
1262 I915_WRITE(GFX_MODE,
1263 _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(GFX_TLB_INVALIDATE_EXPLICIT));
1264
1265 /* WaBCSVCSTlbInvalidationMode:ivb,vlv,hsw */
1266 if (IS_GEN7(dev))
1267 I915_WRITE(GFX_MODE_GEN7,
1268 _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(GFX_TLB_INVALIDATE_EXPLICIT) |
1269 _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(GFX_REPLAY_MODE));
1270
1271 if (IS_GEN6(dev)) {
1272 /* From the Sandybridge PRM, volume 1 part 3, page 24:
1273 * "If this bit is set, STCunit will have LRA as replacement
1274 * policy. [...] This bit must be reset. LRA replacement
1275 * policy is not supported."
1276 */
1277 I915_WRITE(CACHE_MODE_0,
1278 _MASKED_BIT_DISABLE(CM0_STC_EVICT_DISABLE_LRA_SNB));
1279 }
1280
1281 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 6 && INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen < 8)
1282 I915_WRITE(INSTPM, _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(INSTPM_FORCE_ORDERING));
1283
1284 if (HAS_L3_DPF(dev))
1285 I915_WRITE_IMR(ring, ~GT_PARITY_ERROR(dev));
1286
1287 return init_workarounds_ring(ring);
1288}
1289
1290static void render_ring_cleanup(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1291{
1292 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1293 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1294
1295 if (dev_priv->semaphore_obj) {
1296 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(dev_priv->semaphore_obj);
1297 drm_gem_object_unreference(&dev_priv->semaphore_obj->base);
1298 dev_priv->semaphore_obj = NULL;
1299 }
1300
1301 intel_fini_pipe_control(ring);
1302}
1303
1304static int gen8_rcs_signal(struct drm_i915_gem_request *signaller_req,
1305 unsigned int num_dwords)
1306{
1307#define MBOX_UPDATE_DWORDS 8
1308 struct intel_engine_cs *signaller = signaller_req->ring;
1309 struct drm_device *dev = signaller->dev;
1310 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1311 struct intel_engine_cs *waiter;
1312 int i, ret, num_rings;
1313
1314 num_rings = hweight32(INTEL_INFO(dev)->ring_mask);
1315 num_dwords += (num_rings-1) * MBOX_UPDATE_DWORDS;
1316#undef MBOX_UPDATE_DWORDS
1317
1318 ret = intel_ring_begin(signaller_req, num_dwords);
1319 if (ret)
1320 return ret;
1321
1322 for_each_ring(waiter, dev_priv, i) {
1323 u32 seqno;
1324 u64 gtt_offset = signaller->semaphore.signal_ggtt[i];
1325 if (gtt_offset == MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_INVALID)
1326 continue;
1327
1328 seqno = i915_gem_request_get_seqno(signaller_req);
1329 intel_ring_emit(signaller, GFX_OP_PIPE_CONTROL(6));
1330 intel_ring_emit(signaller, PIPE_CONTROL_GLOBAL_GTT_IVB |
1331 PIPE_CONTROL_QW_WRITE |
1332 PIPE_CONTROL_FLUSH_ENABLE);
1333 intel_ring_emit(signaller, lower_32_bits(gtt_offset));
1334 intel_ring_emit(signaller, upper_32_bits(gtt_offset));
1335 intel_ring_emit(signaller, seqno);
1336 intel_ring_emit(signaller, 0);
1337 intel_ring_emit(signaller, MI_SEMAPHORE_SIGNAL |
1338 MI_SEMAPHORE_TARGET(waiter->id));
1339 intel_ring_emit(signaller, 0);
1340 }
1341
1342 return 0;
1343}
1344
1345static int gen8_xcs_signal(struct drm_i915_gem_request *signaller_req,
1346 unsigned int num_dwords)
1347{
1348#define MBOX_UPDATE_DWORDS 6
1349 struct intel_engine_cs *signaller = signaller_req->ring;
1350 struct drm_device *dev = signaller->dev;
1351 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1352 struct intel_engine_cs *waiter;
1353 int i, ret, num_rings;
1354
1355 num_rings = hweight32(INTEL_INFO(dev)->ring_mask);
1356 num_dwords += (num_rings-1) * MBOX_UPDATE_DWORDS;
1357#undef MBOX_UPDATE_DWORDS
1358
1359 ret = intel_ring_begin(signaller_req, num_dwords);
1360 if (ret)
1361 return ret;
1362
1363 for_each_ring(waiter, dev_priv, i) {
1364 u32 seqno;
1365 u64 gtt_offset = signaller->semaphore.signal_ggtt[i];
1366 if (gtt_offset == MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_INVALID)
1367 continue;
1368
1369 seqno = i915_gem_request_get_seqno(signaller_req);
1370 intel_ring_emit(signaller, (MI_FLUSH_DW + 1) |
1371 MI_FLUSH_DW_OP_STOREDW);
1372 intel_ring_emit(signaller, lower_32_bits(gtt_offset) |
1373 MI_FLUSH_DW_USE_GTT);
1374 intel_ring_emit(signaller, upper_32_bits(gtt_offset));
1375 intel_ring_emit(signaller, seqno);
1376 intel_ring_emit(signaller, MI_SEMAPHORE_SIGNAL |
1377 MI_SEMAPHORE_TARGET(waiter->id));
1378 intel_ring_emit(signaller, 0);
1379 }
1380
1381 return 0;
1382}
1383
1384static int gen6_signal(struct drm_i915_gem_request *signaller_req,
1385 unsigned int num_dwords)
1386{
1387 struct intel_engine_cs *signaller = signaller_req->ring;
1388 struct drm_device *dev = signaller->dev;
1389 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1390 struct intel_engine_cs *useless;
1391 int i, ret, num_rings;
1392
1393#define MBOX_UPDATE_DWORDS 3
1394 num_rings = hweight32(INTEL_INFO(dev)->ring_mask);
1395 num_dwords += round_up((num_rings-1) * MBOX_UPDATE_DWORDS, 2);
1396#undef MBOX_UPDATE_DWORDS
1397
1398 ret = intel_ring_begin(signaller_req, num_dwords);
1399 if (ret)
1400 return ret;
1401
1402 for_each_ring(useless, dev_priv, i) {
1403 u32 mbox_reg = signaller->semaphore.mbox.signal[i];
1404 if (mbox_reg != GEN6_NOSYNC) {
1405 u32 seqno = i915_gem_request_get_seqno(signaller_req);
1406 intel_ring_emit(signaller, MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(1));
1407 intel_ring_emit(signaller, mbox_reg);
1408 intel_ring_emit(signaller, seqno);
1409 }
1410 }
1411
1412 /* If num_dwords was rounded, make sure the tail pointer is correct */
1413 if (num_rings % 2 == 0)
1414 intel_ring_emit(signaller, MI_NOOP);
1415
1416 return 0;
1417}
1418
1419/**
1420 * gen6_add_request - Update the semaphore mailbox registers
1421 *
1422 * @request - request to write to the ring
1423 *
1424 * Update the mailbox registers in the *other* rings with the current seqno.
1425 * This acts like a signal in the canonical semaphore.
1426 */
1427static int
1428gen6_add_request(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
1429{
1430 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
1431 int ret;
1432
1433 if (ring->semaphore.signal)
1434 ret = ring->semaphore.signal(req, 4);
1435 else
1436 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 4);
1437
1438 if (ret)
1439 return ret;
1440
1441 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_STORE_DWORD_INDEX);
1442 intel_ring_emit(ring, I915_GEM_HWS_INDEX << MI_STORE_DWORD_INDEX_SHIFT);
1443 intel_ring_emit(ring, i915_gem_request_get_seqno(req));
1444 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_USER_INTERRUPT);
1445 __intel_ring_advance(ring);
1446
1447 return 0;
1448}
1449
1450static inline bool i915_gem_has_seqno_wrapped(struct drm_device *dev,
1451 u32 seqno)
1452{
1453 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1454 return dev_priv->last_seqno < seqno;
1455}
1456
1457/**
1458 * intel_ring_sync - sync the waiter to the signaller on seqno
1459 *
1460 * @waiter - ring that is waiting
1461 * @signaller - ring which has, or will signal
1462 * @seqno - seqno which the waiter will block on
1463 */
1464
1465static int
1466gen8_ring_sync(struct drm_i915_gem_request *waiter_req,
1467 struct intel_engine_cs *signaller,
1468 u32 seqno)
1469{
1470 struct intel_engine_cs *waiter = waiter_req->ring;
1471 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = waiter->dev->dev_private;
1472 int ret;
1473
1474 ret = intel_ring_begin(waiter_req, 4);
1475 if (ret)
1476 return ret;
1477
1478 intel_ring_emit(waiter, MI_SEMAPHORE_WAIT |
1479 MI_SEMAPHORE_GLOBAL_GTT |
1480 MI_SEMAPHORE_POLL |
1481 MI_SEMAPHORE_SAD_GTE_SDD);
1482 intel_ring_emit(waiter, seqno);
1483 intel_ring_emit(waiter,
1484 lower_32_bits(GEN8_WAIT_OFFSET(waiter, signaller->id)));
1485 intel_ring_emit(waiter,
1486 upper_32_bits(GEN8_WAIT_OFFSET(waiter, signaller->id)));
1487 intel_ring_advance(waiter);
1488 return 0;
1489}
1490
1491static int
1492gen6_ring_sync(struct drm_i915_gem_request *waiter_req,
1493 struct intel_engine_cs *signaller,
1494 u32 seqno)
1495{
1496 struct intel_engine_cs *waiter = waiter_req->ring;
1497 u32 dw1 = MI_SEMAPHORE_MBOX |
1498 MI_SEMAPHORE_COMPARE |
1499 MI_SEMAPHORE_REGISTER;
1500 u32 wait_mbox = signaller->semaphore.mbox.wait[waiter->id];
1501 int ret;
1502
1503 /* Throughout all of the GEM code, seqno passed implies our current
1504 * seqno is >= the last seqno executed. However for hardware the
1505 * comparison is strictly greater than.
1506 */
1507 seqno -= 1;
1508
1509 WARN_ON(wait_mbox == MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_INVALID);
1510
1511 ret = intel_ring_begin(waiter_req, 4);
1512 if (ret)
1513 return ret;
1514
1515 /* If seqno wrap happened, omit the wait with no-ops */
1516 if (likely(!i915_gem_has_seqno_wrapped(waiter->dev, seqno))) {
1517 intel_ring_emit(waiter, dw1 | wait_mbox);
1518 intel_ring_emit(waiter, seqno);
1519 intel_ring_emit(waiter, 0);
1520 intel_ring_emit(waiter, MI_NOOP);
1521 } else {
1522 intel_ring_emit(waiter, MI_NOOP);
1523 intel_ring_emit(waiter, MI_NOOP);
1524 intel_ring_emit(waiter, MI_NOOP);
1525 intel_ring_emit(waiter, MI_NOOP);
1526 }
1527 intel_ring_advance(waiter);
1528
1529 return 0;
1530}
1531
1532#define PIPE_CONTROL_FLUSH(ring__, addr__) \
1533do { \
1534 intel_ring_emit(ring__, GFX_OP_PIPE_CONTROL(4) | PIPE_CONTROL_QW_WRITE | \
1535 PIPE_CONTROL_DEPTH_STALL); \
1536 intel_ring_emit(ring__, (addr__) | PIPE_CONTROL_GLOBAL_GTT); \
1537 intel_ring_emit(ring__, 0); \
1538 intel_ring_emit(ring__, 0); \
1539} while (0)
1540
1541static int
1542pc_render_add_request(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
1543{
1544 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
1545 u32 scratch_addr = ring->scratch.gtt_offset + 2 * CACHELINE_BYTES;
1546 int ret;
1547
1548 /* For Ironlake, MI_USER_INTERRUPT was deprecated and apparently
1549 * incoherent with writes to memory, i.e. completely fubar,
1550 * so we need to use PIPE_NOTIFY instead.
1551 *
1552 * However, we also need to workaround the qword write
1553 * incoherence by flushing the 6 PIPE_NOTIFY buffers out to
1554 * memory before requesting an interrupt.
1555 */
1556 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 32);
1557 if (ret)
1558 return ret;
1559
1560 intel_ring_emit(ring, GFX_OP_PIPE_CONTROL(4) | PIPE_CONTROL_QW_WRITE |
1561 PIPE_CONTROL_WRITE_FLUSH |
1562 PIPE_CONTROL_TEXTURE_CACHE_INVALIDATE);
1563 intel_ring_emit(ring, ring->scratch.gtt_offset | PIPE_CONTROL_GLOBAL_GTT);
1564 intel_ring_emit(ring, i915_gem_request_get_seqno(req));
1565 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0);
1566 PIPE_CONTROL_FLUSH(ring, scratch_addr);
1567 scratch_addr += 2 * CACHELINE_BYTES; /* write to separate cachelines */
1568 PIPE_CONTROL_FLUSH(ring, scratch_addr);
1569 scratch_addr += 2 * CACHELINE_BYTES;
1570 PIPE_CONTROL_FLUSH(ring, scratch_addr);
1571 scratch_addr += 2 * CACHELINE_BYTES;
1572 PIPE_CONTROL_FLUSH(ring, scratch_addr);
1573 scratch_addr += 2 * CACHELINE_BYTES;
1574 PIPE_CONTROL_FLUSH(ring, scratch_addr);
1575 scratch_addr += 2 * CACHELINE_BYTES;
1576 PIPE_CONTROL_FLUSH(ring, scratch_addr);
1577
1578 intel_ring_emit(ring, GFX_OP_PIPE_CONTROL(4) | PIPE_CONTROL_QW_WRITE |
1579 PIPE_CONTROL_WRITE_FLUSH |
1580 PIPE_CONTROL_TEXTURE_CACHE_INVALIDATE |
1581 PIPE_CONTROL_NOTIFY);
1582 intel_ring_emit(ring, ring->scratch.gtt_offset | PIPE_CONTROL_GLOBAL_GTT);
1583 intel_ring_emit(ring, i915_gem_request_get_seqno(req));
1584 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0);
1585 __intel_ring_advance(ring);
1586
1587 return 0;
1588}
1589
1590static u32
1591gen6_ring_get_seqno(struct intel_engine_cs *ring, bool lazy_coherency)
1592{
1593 /* Workaround to force correct ordering between irq and seqno writes on
1594 * ivb (and maybe also on snb) by reading from a CS register (like
1595 * ACTHD) before reading the status page. */
1596 if (!lazy_coherency) {
1597 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
1598 POSTING_READ(RING_ACTHD(ring->mmio_base));
1599 }
1600
1601 return intel_read_status_page(ring, I915_GEM_HWS_INDEX);
1602}
1603
1604static u32
1605ring_get_seqno(struct intel_engine_cs *ring, bool lazy_coherency)
1606{
1607 return intel_read_status_page(ring, I915_GEM_HWS_INDEX);
1608}
1609
1610static void
1611ring_set_seqno(struct intel_engine_cs *ring, u32 seqno)
1612{
1613 intel_write_status_page(ring, I915_GEM_HWS_INDEX, seqno);
1614}

1616static u32
1617pc_render_get_seqno(struct intel_engine_cs *ring, bool lazy_coherency)
1618{
1619 return ring->scratch.cpu_page[0];
1620}

1628static bool
1629gen5_ring_get_irq(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1630{
1631 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1632 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1633 unsigned long flags;
1634
1635 if (WARN_ON(!intel_irqs_enabled(dev_priv)))
1636 return false;
1637
1638 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1639 if (ring->irq_refcount++ == 0)
1640 gen5_enable_gt_irq(dev_priv, ring->irq_enable_mask);
1641 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1642
1643 return true;
1644}

1646static void
1647gen5_ring_put_irq(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1648{
1649 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1650 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1651 unsigned long flags;
1652
1653 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1654 if (--ring->irq_refcount == 0)
1655 gen5_disable_gt_irq(dev_priv, ring->irq_enable_mask);
1656 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1657}

1659static bool
1660i9xx_ring_get_irq(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1661{
1662 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1663 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1664 unsigned long flags;
1665
1666 if (!intel_irqs_enabled(dev_priv))
1667 return false;

1670 if (ring->irq_refcount++ == 0) {

1672 I915_WRITE(IMR, dev_priv->irq_mask);
1673 POSTING_READ(IMR);
1674 }
1675 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1676
1677 return true;
1678}

1770static bool
1771gen6_ring_get_irq(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1772{
1773 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1774 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1775 unsigned long flags;
1776
1777 if (WARN_ON(!intel_irqs_enabled(dev_priv)))
1778 return false;
1779
1780 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1781 if (ring->irq_refcount++ == 0) {
1782 if (HAS_L3_DPF(dev) && ring->id == RCS)
1783 I915_WRITE_IMR(ring,
1784 ~(ring->irq_enable_mask |
1785 GT_PARITY_ERROR(dev)));
1786 else
1787 I915_WRITE_IMR(ring, ~ring->irq_enable_mask);
1788 gen5_enable_gt_irq(dev_priv, ring->irq_enable_mask);
1789 }
1790 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1791
1792 return true;
1793}

1795static void
1796gen6_ring_put_irq(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1797{
1798 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1799 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1800 unsigned long flags;
1801
1802 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1803 if (--ring->irq_refcount == 0) {
1804 if (HAS_L3_DPF(dev) && ring->id == RCS)
1805 I915_WRITE_IMR(ring, ~GT_PARITY_ERROR(dev));
1806 else
1807 I915_WRITE_IMR(ring, ~0);
1808 gen5_disable_gt_irq(dev_priv, ring->irq_enable_mask);
1809 }
1810 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1811}
