1848static bool
1849gen8_ring_get_irq(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1850{
1851 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1852 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1853 unsigned long flags;
1854
1855 if (WARN_ON(!intel_irqs_enabled(dev_priv)))
1856 return false;
1857
1858 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1859 if (ring->irq_refcount++ == 0) {
1860 if (HAS_L3_DPF(dev) && ring->id == RCS) {
1861 I915_WRITE_IMR(ring,
1862 ~(ring->irq_enable_mask |
1863 GT_RENDER_L3_PARITY_ERROR_INTERRUPT));
1864 } else {
1865 I915_WRITE_IMR(ring, ~ring->irq_enable_mask);
1866 }
1867 POSTING_READ(RING_IMR(ring->mmio_base));
1868 }
1869 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1870
1871 return true;
1872}
1873
1874static void
1875gen8_ring_put_irq(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
1876{
1877 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
1878 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1879 unsigned long flags;
1880
1881 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1882 if (--ring->irq_refcount == 0) {
1883 if (HAS_L3_DPF(dev) && ring->id == RCS) {
1884 I915_WRITE_IMR(ring,
1885 ~GT_RENDER_L3_PARITY_ERROR_INTERRUPT);
1886 } else {
1887 I915_WRITE_IMR(ring, ~0);
1888 }
1889 POSTING_READ(RING_IMR(ring->mmio_base));
1890 }
1891 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev_priv->irq_lock, flags);
1892}
1893
1894static int
1895i965_dispatch_execbuffer(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
1896 u64 offset, u32 length,
1897 unsigned dispatch_flags)
1898{
1899 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
1900 int ret;
1901
1902 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 2);
1903 if (ret)
1904 return ret;
1905
1906 intel_ring_emit(ring,
1907 MI_BATCH_BUFFER_START |
1908 MI_BATCH_GTT |
1909 (dispatch_flags & I915_DISPATCH_SECURE ?
1910 0 : MI_BATCH_NON_SECURE_I965));
1911 intel_ring_emit(ring, offset);
1912 intel_ring_advance(ring);
1913
1914 return 0;
1915}
1916
1917/* Just userspace ABI convention to limit the wa batch bo to a resonable size */
1918#define I830_BATCH_LIMIT (256*1024)
1919#define I830_TLB_ENTRIES (2)
1920#define I830_WA_SIZE max(I830_TLB_ENTRIES*4096, I830_BATCH_LIMIT)
1921static int
1922i830_dispatch_execbuffer(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
1923 u64 offset, u32 len,
1924 unsigned dispatch_flags)
1925{
1926 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
1927 u32 cs_offset = ring->scratch.gtt_offset;
1928 int ret;
1929
1930 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 6);
1931 if (ret)
1932 return ret;
1933
1934 /* Evict the invalid PTE TLBs */
1935 intel_ring_emit(ring, COLOR_BLT_CMD | BLT_WRITE_RGBA);
1936 intel_ring_emit(ring, BLT_DEPTH_32 | BLT_ROP_COLOR_COPY | 4096);
1937 intel_ring_emit(ring, I830_TLB_ENTRIES << 16 | 4); /* load each page */
1938 intel_ring_emit(ring, cs_offset);
1939 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0xdeadbeef);
1940 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_NOOP);
1941 intel_ring_advance(ring);
1942
1943 if ((dispatch_flags & I915_DISPATCH_PINNED) == 0) {
1944 if (len > I830_BATCH_LIMIT)
1945 return -ENOSPC;
1946
1947 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 6 + 2);
1948 if (ret)
1949 return ret;
1950
1951 /* Blit the batch (which has now all relocs applied) to the
1952 * stable batch scratch bo area (so that the CS never
1953 * stumbles over its tlb invalidation bug) ...
1954 */
1955 intel_ring_emit(ring, SRC_COPY_BLT_CMD | BLT_WRITE_RGBA);
1956 intel_ring_emit(ring, BLT_DEPTH_32 | BLT_ROP_SRC_COPY | 4096);
1957 intel_ring_emit(ring, DIV_ROUND_UP(len, 4096) << 16 | 4096);
1958 intel_ring_emit(ring, cs_offset);
1959 intel_ring_emit(ring, 4096);
1960 intel_ring_emit(ring, offset);
1961
1962 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_FLUSH);
1963 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_NOOP);
1964 intel_ring_advance(ring);
1965
1966 /* ... and execute it. */
1967 offset = cs_offset;
1968 }
1969
1970 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 4);
1971 if (ret)
1972 return ret;
1973
1974 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_BATCH_BUFFER);
1975 intel_ring_emit(ring, offset | (dispatch_flags & I915_DISPATCH_SECURE ?
1976 0 : MI_BATCH_NON_SECURE));
1977 intel_ring_emit(ring, offset + len - 8);
1978 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_NOOP);
1979 intel_ring_advance(ring);
1980
1981 return 0;
1982}
1983
1984static int
1985i915_dispatch_execbuffer(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
1986 u64 offset, u32 len,
1987 unsigned dispatch_flags)
1988{
1989 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
1990 int ret;
1991
1992 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 2);
1993 if (ret)
1994 return ret;
1995
1996 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_BATCH_BUFFER_START | MI_BATCH_GTT);
1997 intel_ring_emit(ring, offset | (dispatch_flags & I915_DISPATCH_SECURE ?
1998 0 : MI_BATCH_NON_SECURE));
1999 intel_ring_advance(ring);
2000
2001 return 0;
2002}
2003
2004static void cleanup_phys_status_page(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
2005{
2006 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = to_i915(ring->dev);
2007
2008 if (!dev_priv->status_page_dmah)
2009 return;
2010
2011 drm_pci_free(ring->dev, dev_priv->status_page_dmah);
2012 ring->status_page.page_addr = NULL;
2013}
2014
2015static void cleanup_status_page(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
2016{
2017 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
2018
2019 obj = ring->status_page.obj;
2020 if (obj == NULL)
2021 return;
2022
2023#ifdef __NetBSD__
2024 kunmap(container_of(TAILQ_FIRST(&obj->pageq), struct page, p_vmp));
2025#else
2026 kunmap(sg_page(obj->pages->sgl));
2027#endif
2028 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(obj);
2029 drm_gem_object_unreference(&obj->base);
2030 ring->status_page.obj = NULL;
2031}
2032
2033static int init_status_page(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
2034{
2035 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = ring->status_page.obj;
2036
2037 if (obj == NULL) {
2038 unsigned flags;
2039 int ret;
2040
2041 obj = i915_gem_alloc_object(ring->dev, 4096);
2042 if (obj == NULL) {
2043 DRM_ERROR("Failed to allocate status page\n");
2044 return -ENOMEM;
2045 }
2046
2047 ret = i915_gem_object_set_cache_level(obj, I915_CACHE_LLC);
2048 if (ret)
2049 goto err_unref;
2050
2051 flags = 0;
2052 if (!HAS_LLC(ring->dev))
2053 /* On g33, we cannot place HWS above 256MiB, so
2054 * restrict its pinning to the low mappable arena.
2055 * Though this restriction is not documented for
2056 * gen4, gen5, or byt, they also behave similarly
2057 * and hang if the HWS is placed at the top of the
2058 * GTT. To generalise, it appears that all !llc
2059 * platforms have issues with us placing the HWS
2060 * above the mappable region (even though we never
2061 * actualy map it).
2062 */
2063 flags |= PIN_MAPPABLE;
2064 ret = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_pin(obj, 4096, flags);
2065 if (ret) {
2066err_unref:
2067 drm_gem_object_unreference(&obj->base);
2068 return ret;
2069 }
2070
2071 ring->status_page.obj = obj;
2072 }
2073
2074 ring->status_page.gfx_addr = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj);
2075#ifdef __NetBSD__
2076 ring->status_page.page_addr =
2077 kmap(container_of(TAILQ_FIRST(&obj->pageq), struct page, p_vmp));
2078#else
2079 ring->status_page.page_addr = kmap(sg_page(obj->pages->sgl));
2080#endif
2081 memset(ring->status_page.page_addr, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
2082
2083 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("%s hws offset: 0x%08x\n",
2084 ring->name, ring->status_page.gfx_addr);
2085
2086 return 0;
2087}
2088
2089static int init_phys_status_page(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
2090{
2091 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
2092
2093 if (!dev_priv->status_page_dmah) {
2094 dev_priv->status_page_dmah =
2095 drm_pci_alloc(ring->dev, PAGE_SIZE, PAGE_SIZE);
2096 if (!dev_priv->status_page_dmah)
2097 return -ENOMEM;
2098 }
2099
2100 ring->status_page.page_addr = dev_priv->status_page_dmah->vaddr;
2101 memset(ring->status_page.page_addr, 0, PAGE_SIZE);
2102
2103 return 0;
2104}
2105
2106void intel_unpin_ringbuffer_obj(struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf)
2107{
2108#ifdef __NetBSD__
2109 bus_space_unmap(ringbuf->bst, ringbuf->bsh, ringbuf->size);
2110#else
2111 iounmap(ringbuf->virtual_start);
2112 ringbuf->virtual_start = NULL;
2113#endif
2114 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(ringbuf->obj);
2115}
2116
2117int intel_pin_and_map_ringbuffer_obj(struct drm_device *dev,
2118 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf)
2119{
2120 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = to_i915(dev);
2121 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = ringbuf->obj;
2122 int ret;
2123
2124 ret = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_pin(obj, PAGE_SIZE, PIN_MAPPABLE);
2125 if (ret)
2126 return ret;
2127
2128 ret = i915_gem_object_set_to_gtt_domain(obj, true);
2129 if (ret) {
2130 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(obj);
2131 return ret;
2132 }
2133
2134#ifdef __NetBSD__
2135 /* XXX errno NetBSD->Linux */
2136 ringbuf->bst = dev_priv->dev->pdev->pd_pa.pa_memt;
2137 ret = -bus_space_map(ringbuf->bst, (dev_priv->gtt.mappable_base +
2138 i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj)),
2139 ringbuf->size, BUS_SPACE_MAP_PREFETCHABLE, &ringbuf->bsh);
2140 if (ret) {
2141 DRM_ERROR("Failed to map ringbuffer: %d\n", ret);
2142 return ret;
2143 }
2144#else
2145 ringbuf->virtual_start = ioremap_wc(dev_priv->gtt.mappable_base +
2146 i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj), ringbuf->size);
2147 if (ringbuf->virtual_start == NULL) {
2148 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(obj);
2149 return -EINVAL;
2150 }
2151#endif
2152
2153 return 0;
2154}
2155
2156static void intel_destroy_ringbuffer_obj(struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf)
2157{
2158 drm_gem_object_unreference(&ringbuf->obj->base);
2159 ringbuf->obj = NULL;
2160}
2161
2162static int intel_alloc_ringbuffer_obj(struct drm_device *dev,
2163 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf)
2164{
2165 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
2166
2167 obj = NULL;
2168 if (!HAS_LLC(dev))
2169 obj = i915_gem_object_create_stolen(dev, ringbuf->size);
2170 if (obj == NULL)
2171 obj = i915_gem_alloc_object(dev, ringbuf->size);
2172 if (obj == NULL)
2173 return -ENOMEM;
2174
2175 /* mark ring buffers as read-only from GPU side by default */
2176 obj->gt_ro = 1;
2177
2178 ringbuf->obj = obj;
2179
2180 return 0;
2181}
2182
2183struct intel_ringbuffer *
2184intel_engine_create_ringbuffer(struct intel_engine_cs *engine, int size)
2185{
2186 struct intel_ringbuffer *ring;
2187 int ret;
2188
2189 ring = kzalloc(sizeof(*ring), GFP_KERNEL);
2190 if (ring == NULL)
2191 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
2192
2193 ring->ring = engine;
2194
2195 ring->size = size;
2196 /* Workaround an erratum on the i830 which causes a hang if
2197 * the TAIL pointer points to within the last 2 cachelines
2198 * of the buffer.
2199 */
2200 ring->effective_size = size;
2201 if (IS_I830(engine->dev) || IS_845G(engine->dev))
2202 ring->effective_size -= 2 * CACHELINE_BYTES;
2203
2204 ring->last_retired_head = -1;
2205 intel_ring_update_space(ring);
2206
2207 ret = intel_alloc_ringbuffer_obj(engine->dev, ring);
2208 if (ret) {
2209 DRM_ERROR("Failed to allocate ringbuffer %s: %d\n",
2210 engine->name, ret);
2211 kfree(ring);
2212 return ERR_PTR(ret);
2213 }
2214
2215 return ring;
2216}
2217
2218void
2219intel_ringbuffer_free(struct intel_ringbuffer *ring)
2220{
2221 intel_destroy_ringbuffer_obj(ring);
2222 kfree(ring);
2223}
2224
2225static int intel_init_ring_buffer(struct drm_device *dev,
2226 struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
2227{
2228 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf;
2229 int ret;
2230
2231 WARN_ON(ring->buffer);
2232
2233 ring->dev = dev;
2234 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ring->active_list);
2235 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ring->request_list);
2236 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ring->execlist_queue);
2237 i915_gem_batch_pool_init(dev, &ring->batch_pool);
2238 memset(ring->semaphore.sync_seqno, 0, sizeof(ring->semaphore.sync_seqno));
2239
2240#ifdef __NetBSD__
2241 DRM_INIT_WAITQUEUE(&ring->irq_queue, "i915irq");
2242#else
2243 init_waitqueue_head(&ring->irq_queue);
2244#endif
2245
2246 ringbuf = intel_engine_create_ringbuffer(ring, 32 * PAGE_SIZE);
2247 if (IS_ERR(ringbuf))
2248 return PTR_ERR(ringbuf);
2249 ring->buffer = ringbuf;
2250
2251 if (I915_NEED_GFX_HWS(dev)) {
2252 ret = init_status_page(ring);
2253 if (ret)
2254 goto error;
2255 } else {
2256 WARN_ON(ring->id != RCS);
2257 ret = init_phys_status_page(ring);
2258 if (ret)
2259 goto error;
2260 }
2261
2262 ret = intel_pin_and_map_ringbuffer_obj(dev, ringbuf);
2263 if (ret) {
2264 DRM_ERROR("Failed to pin and map ringbuffer %s: %d\n",
2265 ring->name, ret);
2266 intel_destroy_ringbuffer_obj(ringbuf);
2267 goto error;
2268 }
2269
2270 ret = i915_cmd_parser_init_ring(ring);
2271 if (ret)
2272 goto error;
2273
2274 return 0;
2275
2276error:
2277 intel_ringbuffer_free(ringbuf);
2278#ifdef __NetBSD__
2279 DRM_DESTROY_WAITQUEUE(&ring->irq_queue);
2280#endif
2281 ring->buffer = NULL;
2282 return ret;
2283}
2284
2285void intel_cleanup_ring_buffer(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
2286{
2287 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv;
2288
2289 if (!intel_ring_initialized(ring))
2290 return;
2291
2292 dev_priv = to_i915(ring->dev);
2293
2294 intel_stop_ring_buffer(ring);
2295 WARN_ON(!IS_GEN2(ring->dev) && (I915_READ_MODE(ring) & MODE_IDLE) == 0);
2296
2297 intel_unpin_ringbuffer_obj(ring->buffer);
2298 intel_ringbuffer_free(ring->buffer);
2299 ring->buffer = NULL;
2300
2301 if (ring->cleanup)
2302 ring->cleanup(ring);
2303
2304 if (I915_NEED_GFX_HWS(ring->dev)) {
2305 cleanup_status_page(ring);
2306 } else {
2307 WARN_ON(ring->id != RCS);
2308 cleanup_phys_status_page(ring);
2309 }
2310
2311 i915_cmd_parser_fini_ring(ring);
2312 i915_gem_batch_pool_fini(&ring->batch_pool);
2313
2314#ifdef __NetBSD__
2315 DRM_DESTROY_WAITQUEUE(&ring->irq_queue);
2316#endif
2317}
2318
2319static int ring_wait_for_space(struct intel_engine_cs *ring, int n)
2320{
2321 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = ring->buffer;
2322 struct drm_i915_gem_request *request;
2323 unsigned space;
2324 int ret;
2325
2326 if (intel_ring_space(ringbuf) >= n)
2327 return 0;
2328
2329 /* The whole point of reserving space is to not wait! */
2330 WARN_ON(ringbuf->reserved_in_use);
2331
2332 list_for_each_entry(request, &ring->request_list, list) {
2333 space = __intel_ring_space(request->postfix, ringbuf->tail,
2334 ringbuf->size);
2335 if (space >= n)
2336 break;
2337 }
2338
2339 if (WARN_ON(&request->list == &ring->request_list))
2340 return -ENOSPC;
2341
2342 ret = i915_wait_request(request);
2343 if (ret)
2344 return ret;
2345
2346 ringbuf->space = space;
2347 return 0;
2348}
2349
2350static void __wrap_ring_buffer(struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf)
2351{
2352#ifndef __NetBSD__
2353 uint32_t __iomem *virt;
2354#endif
2355 int rem = ringbuf->size - ringbuf->tail;
2356
2357#ifdef __NetBSD__
2358 bus_space_set_region_4(ringbuf->bst, ringbuf->bsh, ringbuf->tail,
2359 MI_NOOP, rem/4);
2360#else
2361 virt = ringbuf->virtual_start + ringbuf->tail;
2362 rem /= 4;
2363 while (rem--)
2364 iowrite32(MI_NOOP, virt++);
2365#endif
2366
2367 ringbuf->tail = 0;
2368 intel_ring_update_space(ringbuf);
2369}
2370
2371int intel_ring_idle(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
2372{
2373 struct drm_i915_gem_request *req;
2374
2375 /* Wait upon the last request to be completed */
2376 if (list_empty(&ring->request_list))
2377 return 0;
2378
2379 req = list_entry(ring->request_list.prev,
2380 struct drm_i915_gem_request,
2381 list);
2382
2383 /* Make sure we do not trigger any retires */
2384 return __i915_wait_request(req,
2385 atomic_read(&to_i915(ring->dev)->gpu_error.reset_counter),
2386 to_i915(ring->dev)->mm.interruptible,
2387 NULL, NULL);
2388}
2389
2390int intel_ring_alloc_request_extras(struct drm_i915_gem_request *request)
2391{
2392 request->ringbuf = request->ring->buffer;
2393 return 0;
2394}
2395
2396int intel_ring_reserve_space(struct drm_i915_gem_request *request)
2397{
2398 /*
2399 * The first call merely notes the reserve request and is common for
2400 * all back ends. The subsequent localised _begin() call actually
2401 * ensures that the reservation is available. Without the begin, if
2402 * the request creator immediately submitted the request without
2403 * adding any commands to it then there might not actually be
2404 * sufficient room for the submission commands.
2405 */
2406 intel_ring_reserved_space_reserve(request->ringbuf, MIN_SPACE_FOR_ADD_REQUEST);
2407
2408 return intel_ring_begin(request, 0);
2409}
2410
2411void intel_ring_reserved_space_reserve(struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf, int size)
2412{
2413 WARN_ON(ringbuf->reserved_size);
2414 WARN_ON(ringbuf->reserved_in_use);
2415
2416 ringbuf->reserved_size = size;
2417}
2418
2419void intel_ring_reserved_space_cancel(struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf)
2420{
2421 WARN_ON(ringbuf->reserved_in_use);
2422
2423 ringbuf->reserved_size = 0;
2424 ringbuf->reserved_in_use = false;
2425}
2426
2427void intel_ring_reserved_space_use(struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf)
2428{
2429 WARN_ON(ringbuf->reserved_in_use);
2430
2431 ringbuf->reserved_in_use = true;
2432 ringbuf->reserved_tail = ringbuf->tail;
2433}
2434
2435void intel_ring_reserved_space_end(struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf)
2436{
2437 WARN_ON(!ringbuf->reserved_in_use);
2438 if (ringbuf->tail > ringbuf->reserved_tail) {
2439 WARN(ringbuf->tail > ringbuf->reserved_tail + ringbuf->reserved_size,
2440 "request reserved size too small: %d vs %d!\n",
2441 ringbuf->tail - ringbuf->reserved_tail, ringbuf->reserved_size);
2442 } else {
2443 /*
2444 * The ring was wrapped while the reserved space was in use.
2445 * That means that some unknown amount of the ring tail was
2446 * no-op filled and skipped. Thus simply adding the ring size
2447 * to the tail and doing the above space check will not work.
2448 * Rather than attempt to track how much tail was skipped,
2449 * it is much simpler to say that also skipping the sanity
2450 * check every once in a while is not a big issue.
2451 */
2452 }
2453
2454 ringbuf->reserved_size = 0;
2455 ringbuf->reserved_in_use = false;
2456}
2457
2458static int __intel_ring_prepare(struct intel_engine_cs *ring, int bytes)
2459{
2460 struct intel_ringbuffer *ringbuf = ring->buffer;
2461 int remain_usable = ringbuf->effective_size - ringbuf->tail;
2462 int remain_actual = ringbuf->size - ringbuf->tail;
2463 int ret, total_bytes, wait_bytes = 0;
2464 bool need_wrap = false;
2465
2466 if (ringbuf->reserved_in_use)
2467 total_bytes = bytes;
2468 else
2469 total_bytes = bytes + ringbuf->reserved_size;
2470
2471 if (unlikely(bytes > remain_usable)) {
2472 /*
2473 * Not enough space for the basic request. So need to flush
2474 * out the remainder and then wait for base + reserved.
2475 */
2476 wait_bytes = remain_actual + total_bytes;
2477 need_wrap = true;
2478 } else {
2479 if (unlikely(total_bytes > remain_usable)) {
2480 /*
2481 * The base request will fit but the reserved space
2482 * falls off the end. So don't need an immediate wrap
2483 * and only need to effectively wait for the reserved
2484 * size space from the start of ringbuffer.
2485 */
2486 wait_bytes = remain_actual + ringbuf->reserved_size;
2487 } else if (total_bytes > ringbuf->space) {
2488 /* No wrapping required, just waiting. */
2489 wait_bytes = total_bytes;
2490 }
2491 }
2492
2493 if (wait_bytes) {
2494 ret = ring_wait_for_space(ring, wait_bytes);
2495 if (unlikely(ret))
2496 return ret;
2497
2498 if (need_wrap)
2499 __wrap_ring_buffer(ringbuf);
2500 }
2501
2502 return 0;
2503}
2504
2505int intel_ring_begin(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
2506 int num_dwords)
2507{
2508 struct intel_engine_cs *ring;
2509 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv;
2510 int ret;
2511
2512 WARN_ON(req == NULL);
2513 ring = req->ring;
2514 dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
2515
2516 ret = i915_gem_check_wedge(&dev_priv->gpu_error,
2517 dev_priv->mm.interruptible);
2518 if (ret)
2519 return ret;
2520
2521 ret = __intel_ring_prepare(ring, num_dwords * sizeof(uint32_t));
2522 if (ret)
2523 return ret;
2524
2525 ring->buffer->space -= num_dwords * sizeof(uint32_t);
2526 return 0;
2527}
2528
2529/* Align the ring tail to a cacheline boundary */
2530int intel_ring_cacheline_align(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
2531{
2532 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
2533 int num_dwords = (ring->buffer->tail & (CACHELINE_BYTES - 1)) / sizeof(uint32_t);
2534 int ret;
2535
2536 if (num_dwords == 0)
2537 return 0;
2538
2539 num_dwords = CACHELINE_BYTES / sizeof(uint32_t) - num_dwords;
2540 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, num_dwords);
2541 if (ret)
2542 return ret;
2543
2544 while (num_dwords--)
2545 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_NOOP);
2546
2547 intel_ring_advance(ring);
2548
2549 return 0;
2550}
2551
2552void intel_ring_init_seqno(struct intel_engine_cs *ring, u32 seqno)
2553{
2554 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
2555 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2556
2557 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen == 6 || INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen == 7) {
2558 I915_WRITE(RING_SYNC_0(ring->mmio_base), 0);
2559 I915_WRITE(RING_SYNC_1(ring->mmio_base), 0);
2560 if (HAS_VEBOX(dev))
2561 I915_WRITE(RING_SYNC_2(ring->mmio_base), 0);
2562 }
2563
2564 ring->set_seqno(ring, seqno);
2565 ring->hangcheck.seqno = seqno;
2566}
2567
2568static void gen6_bsd_ring_write_tail(struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
2569 u32 value)
2570{
2571 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
2572
2573 /* Every tail move must follow the sequence below */
2574
2575 /* Disable notification that the ring is IDLE. The GT
2576 * will then assume that it is busy and bring it out of rc6.
2577 */
2578 I915_WRITE(GEN6_BSD_SLEEP_PSMI_CONTROL,
2579 _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(GEN6_BSD_SLEEP_MSG_DISABLE));
2580
2581 /* Clear the context id. Here be magic! */
2582 I915_WRITE64(GEN6_BSD_RNCID, 0x0);
2583
2584 /* Wait for the ring not to be idle, i.e. for it to wake up. */
2585 if (wait_for((I915_READ(GEN6_BSD_SLEEP_PSMI_CONTROL) &
2586 GEN6_BSD_SLEEP_INDICATOR) == 0,
2587 50))
2588 DRM_ERROR("timed out waiting for the BSD ring to wake up\n");
2589
2590 /* Now that the ring is fully powered up, update the tail */
2591 I915_WRITE_TAIL(ring, value);
2592 POSTING_READ(RING_TAIL(ring->mmio_base));
2593
2594 /* Let the ring send IDLE messages to the GT again,
2595 * and so let it sleep to conserve power when idle.
2596 */
2597 I915_WRITE(GEN6_BSD_SLEEP_PSMI_CONTROL,
2598 _MASKED_BIT_DISABLE(GEN6_BSD_SLEEP_MSG_DISABLE));
2599}
2600
2601static int gen6_bsd_ring_flush(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
2602 u32 invalidate, u32 flush)
2603{
2604 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
2605 uint32_t cmd;
2606 int ret;
2607
2608 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 4);
2609 if (ret)
2610 return ret;
2611
2612 cmd = MI_FLUSH_DW;
2613 if (INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen >= 8)
2614 cmd += 1;
2615
2616 /* We always require a command barrier so that subsequent
2617 * commands, such as breadcrumb interrupts, are strictly ordered
2618 * wrt the contents of the write cache being flushed to memory
2619 * (and thus being coherent from the CPU).
2620 */
2621 cmd |= MI_FLUSH_DW_STORE_INDEX | MI_FLUSH_DW_OP_STOREDW;
2622
2623 /*
2624 * Bspec vol 1c.5 - video engine command streamer:
2625 * "If ENABLED, all TLBs will be invalidated once the flush
2626 * operation is complete. This bit is only valid when the
2627 * Post-Sync Operation field is a value of 1h or 3h."
2628 */
2629 if (invalidate & I915_GEM_GPU_DOMAINS)
2630 cmd |= MI_INVALIDATE_TLB | MI_INVALIDATE_BSD;
2631
2632 intel_ring_emit(ring, cmd);
2633 intel_ring_emit(ring, I915_GEM_HWS_SCRATCH_ADDR | MI_FLUSH_DW_USE_GTT);
2634 if (INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen >= 8) {
2635 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0); /* upper addr */
2636 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0); /* value */
2637 } else {
2638 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0);
2639 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_NOOP);
2640 }
2641 intel_ring_advance(ring);
2642 return 0;
2643}
2644
2645static int
2646gen8_ring_dispatch_execbuffer(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
2647 u64 offset, u32 len,
2648 unsigned dispatch_flags)
2649{
2650 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
2651 bool ppgtt = USES_PPGTT(ring->dev) &&
2652 !(dispatch_flags & I915_DISPATCH_SECURE);
2653 int ret;
2654
2655 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 4);
2656 if (ret)
2657 return ret;
2658
2659 /* FIXME(BDW): Address space and security selectors. */
2660 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_BATCH_BUFFER_START_GEN8 | (ppgtt<<8) |
2661 (dispatch_flags & I915_DISPATCH_RS ?
2662 MI_BATCH_RESOURCE_STREAMER : 0));
2663 intel_ring_emit(ring, lower_32_bits(offset));
2664 intel_ring_emit(ring, upper_32_bits(offset));
2665 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_NOOP);
2666 intel_ring_advance(ring);
2667
2668 return 0;
2669}
2670
2671static int
2672hsw_ring_dispatch_execbuffer(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
2673 u64 offset, u32 len,
2674 unsigned dispatch_flags)
2675{
2676 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
2677 int ret;
2678
2679 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 2);
2680 if (ret)
2681 return ret;
2682
2683 intel_ring_emit(ring,
2684 MI_BATCH_BUFFER_START |
2685 (dispatch_flags & I915_DISPATCH_SECURE ?
2686 0 : MI_BATCH_PPGTT_HSW | MI_BATCH_NON_SECURE_HSW) |
2687 (dispatch_flags & I915_DISPATCH_RS ?
2688 MI_BATCH_RESOURCE_STREAMER : 0));
2689 /* bit0-7 is the length on GEN6+ */
2690 intel_ring_emit(ring, offset);
2691 intel_ring_advance(ring);
2692
2693 return 0;
2694}
2695
2696static int
2697gen6_ring_dispatch_execbuffer(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
2698 u64 offset, u32 len,
2699 unsigned dispatch_flags)
2700{
2701 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
2702 int ret;
2703
2704 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 2);
2705 if (ret)
2706 return ret;
2707
2708 intel_ring_emit(ring,
2709 MI_BATCH_BUFFER_START |
2710 (dispatch_flags & I915_DISPATCH_SECURE ?
2711 0 : MI_BATCH_NON_SECURE_I965));
2712 /* bit0-7 is the length on GEN6+ */
2713 intel_ring_emit(ring, offset);
2714 intel_ring_advance(ring);
2715
2716 return 0;
2717}
2718
2719/* Blitter support (SandyBridge+) */
2720
2721static int gen6_ring_flush(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req,
2722 u32 invalidate, u32 flush)
2723{
2724 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
2725 struct drm_device *dev = ring->dev;
2726 uint32_t cmd;
2727 int ret;
2728
2729 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, 4);
2730 if (ret)
2731 return ret;
2732
2733 cmd = MI_FLUSH_DW;
2734 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 8)
2735 cmd += 1;
2736
2737 /* We always require a command barrier so that subsequent
2738 * commands, such as breadcrumb interrupts, are strictly ordered
2739 * wrt the contents of the write cache being flushed to memory
2740 * (and thus being coherent from the CPU).
2741 */
2742 cmd |= MI_FLUSH_DW_STORE_INDEX | MI_FLUSH_DW_OP_STOREDW;
2743
2744 /*
2745 * Bspec vol 1c.3 - blitter engine command streamer:
2746 * "If ENABLED, all TLBs will be invalidated once the flush
2747 * operation is complete. This bit is only valid when the
2748 * Post-Sync Operation field is a value of 1h or 3h."
2749 */
2750 if (invalidate & I915_GEM_DOMAIN_RENDER)
2751 cmd |= MI_INVALIDATE_TLB;
2752 intel_ring_emit(ring, cmd);
2753 intel_ring_emit(ring, I915_GEM_HWS_SCRATCH_ADDR | MI_FLUSH_DW_USE_GTT);
2754 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 8) {
2755 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0); /* upper addr */
2756 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0); /* value */
2757 } else {
2758 intel_ring_emit(ring, 0);
2759 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_NOOP);
2760 }
2761 intel_ring_advance(ring);
2762
2763 return 0;
2764}
2765
2766int intel_init_render_ring_buffer(struct drm_device *dev)
2767{
2768 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2769 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = &dev_priv->ring[RCS];
2770 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
2771 int ret;
2772
2773 ring->name = "render ring";
2774 ring->id = RCS;
2775 ring->mmio_base = RENDER_RING_BASE;
2776
2777 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 8) {
2778 if (i915_semaphore_is_enabled(dev)) {
2779 obj = i915_gem_alloc_object(dev, 4096);
2780 if (obj == NULL) {
2781 DRM_ERROR("Failed to allocate semaphore bo. Disabling semaphores\n");
2782 i915.semaphores = 0;
2783 } else {
2784 i915_gem_object_set_cache_level(obj, I915_CACHE_LLC);
2785 ret = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_pin(obj, 0, PIN_NONBLOCK);
2786 if (ret != 0) {
2787 drm_gem_object_unreference(&obj->base);
2788 DRM_ERROR("Failed to pin semaphore bo. Disabling semaphores\n");
2789 i915.semaphores = 0;
2790 } else
2791 dev_priv->semaphore_obj = obj;
2792 }
2793 }
2794
2795 ring->init_context = intel_rcs_ctx_init;
2796 ring->add_request = gen6_add_request;
2797 ring->flush = gen8_render_ring_flush;
2798 ring->irq_get = gen8_ring_get_irq;
2799 ring->irq_put = gen8_ring_put_irq;
2800 ring->irq_enable_mask = GT_RENDER_USER_INTERRUPT;
2801 ring->get_seqno = gen6_ring_get_seqno;
2802 ring->set_seqno = ring_set_seqno;
2803 if (i915_semaphore_is_enabled(dev)) {
2804 WARN_ON(!dev_priv->semaphore_obj);
2805 ring->semaphore.sync_to = gen8_ring_sync;
2806 ring->semaphore.signal = gen8_rcs_signal;
2807 GEN8_RING_SEMAPHORE_INIT;
2808 }
2809 } else if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 6) {
2810 ring->init_context = intel_rcs_ctx_init;
2811 ring->add_request = gen6_add_request;
2812 ring->flush = gen7_render_ring_flush;
2813 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen == 6)
2814 ring->flush = gen6_render_ring_flush;
2815 ring->irq_get = gen6_ring_get_irq;
2816 ring->irq_put = gen6_ring_put_irq;
2817 ring->irq_enable_mask = GT_RENDER_USER_INTERRUPT;
2818 ring->get_seqno = gen6_ring_get_seqno;
2819 ring->set_seqno = ring_set_seqno;
2820 if (i915_semaphore_is_enabled(dev)) {
2821 ring->semaphore.sync_to = gen6_ring_sync;
2822 ring->semaphore.signal = gen6_signal;
2823 /*
2824 * The current semaphore is only applied on pre-gen8
2825 * platform. And there is no VCS2 ring on the pre-gen8
2826 * platform. So the semaphore between RCS and VCS2 is
2827 * initialized as INVALID. Gen8 will initialize the
2828 * sema between VCS2 and RCS later.
2829 */
2830 ring->semaphore.mbox.wait[RCS] = MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_INVALID;
2831 ring->semaphore.mbox.wait[VCS] = MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_RV;
2832 ring->semaphore.mbox.wait[BCS] = MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_RB;
2833 ring->semaphore.mbox.wait[VECS] = MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_RVE;
2834 ring->semaphore.mbox.wait[VCS2] = MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_INVALID;
2835 ring->semaphore.mbox.signal[RCS] = GEN6_NOSYNC;
2836 ring->semaphore.mbox.signal[VCS] = GEN6_VRSYNC;
2837 ring->semaphore.mbox.signal[BCS] = GEN6_BRSYNC;
2838 ring->semaphore.mbox.signal[VECS] = GEN6_VERSYNC;
2839 ring->semaphore.mbox.signal[VCS2] = GEN6_NOSYNC;
2840 }
2841 } else if (IS_GEN5(dev)) {
2842 ring->add_request = pc_render_add_request;
2843 ring->flush = gen4_render_ring_flush;
2844 ring->get_seqno = pc_render_get_seqno;
2845 ring->set_seqno = pc_render_set_seqno;
2846 ring->irq_get = gen5_ring_get_irq;
2847 ring->irq_put = gen5_ring_put_irq;
2848 ring->irq_enable_mask = GT_RENDER_USER_INTERRUPT |
2849 GT_RENDER_PIPECTL_NOTIFY_INTERRUPT;
2850 } else {
2851 ring->add_request = i9xx_add_request;
2852 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen < 4)
2853 ring->flush = gen2_render_ring_flush;
2854 else
2855 ring->flush = gen4_render_ring_flush;
2856 ring->get_seqno = ring_get_seqno;
2857 ring->set_seqno = ring_set_seqno;
2858 if (IS_GEN2(dev)) {
2859 ring->irq_get = i8xx_ring_get_irq;
2860 ring->irq_put = i8xx_ring_put_irq;
2861 } else {
2862 ring->irq_get = i9xx_ring_get_irq;
2863 ring->irq_put = i9xx_ring_put_irq;
2864 }
2865 ring->irq_enable_mask = I915_USER_INTERRUPT;
2866 }
2867 ring->write_tail = ring_write_tail;
2868
2869 if (IS_HASWELL(dev))
2870 ring->dispatch_execbuffer = hsw_ring_dispatch_execbuffer;
2871 else if (IS_GEN8(dev))
2872 ring->dispatch_execbuffer = gen8_ring_dispatch_execbuffer;
2873 else if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 6)
2874 ring->dispatch_execbuffer = gen6_ring_dispatch_execbuffer;
2875 else if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 4)
2876 ring->dispatch_execbuffer = i965_dispatch_execbuffer;
2877 else if (IS_I830(dev) || IS_845G(dev))
2878 ring->dispatch_execbuffer = i830_dispatch_execbuffer;
2879 else
2880 ring->dispatch_execbuffer = i915_dispatch_execbuffer;
2881 ring->init_hw = init_render_ring;
2882 ring->cleanup = render_ring_cleanup;
2883
2884 /* Workaround batchbuffer to combat CS tlb bug. */
2885 if (HAS_BROKEN_CS_TLB(dev)) {
2886 obj = i915_gem_alloc_object(dev, I830_WA_SIZE);
2887 if (obj == NULL) {
2888 DRM_ERROR("Failed to allocate batch bo\n");
2889 return -ENOMEM;
2890 }
2891
2892 ret = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_pin(obj, 0, 0);
2893 if (ret != 0) {
2894 drm_gem_object_unreference(&obj->base);
2895 DRM_ERROR("Failed to ping batch bo\n");
2896 return ret;
2897 }
2898
2899 ring->scratch.obj = obj;
2900 ring->scratch.gtt_offset = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(obj);
2901 }
2902
2903 ret = intel_init_ring_buffer(dev, ring);
2904 if (ret)
2905 return ret;
2906
2907 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 5) {
2908 ret = intel_init_pipe_control(ring);
2909 if (ret)
2910 return ret;
2911 }
2912
2913 return 0;
2914}
2915
2916int intel_init_bsd_ring_buffer(struct drm_device *dev)
2917{
2918 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2919 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = &dev_priv->ring[VCS];
2920
2921 ring->name = "bsd ring";
2922 ring->id = VCS;
2923
2924 ring->write_tail = ring_write_tail;
2925 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 6) {
2926 ring->mmio_base = GEN6_BSD_RING_BASE;
2927 /* gen6 bsd needs a special wa for tail updates */
2928 if (IS_GEN6(dev))
2929 ring->write_tail = gen6_bsd_ring_write_tail;
2930 ring->flush = gen6_bsd_ring_flush;
2931 ring->add_request = gen6_add_request;
2932 ring->get_seqno = gen6_ring_get_seqno;
2933 ring->set_seqno = ring_set_seqno;
2934 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 8) {
2935 ring->irq_enable_mask =
2936 GT_RENDER_USER_INTERRUPT << GEN8_VCS1_IRQ_SHIFT;
2937 ring->irq_get = gen8_ring_get_irq;
2938 ring->irq_put = gen8_ring_put_irq;
2939 ring->dispatch_execbuffer =
2940 gen8_ring_dispatch_execbuffer;
2941 if (i915_semaphore_is_enabled(dev)) {
2942 ring->semaphore.sync_to = gen8_ring_sync;
2943 ring->semaphore.signal = gen8_xcs_signal;
2944 GEN8_RING_SEMAPHORE_INIT;
2945 }
2946 } else {
2947 ring->irq_enable_mask = GT_BSD_USER_INTERRUPT;
2948 ring->irq_get = gen6_ring_get_irq;
2949 ring->irq_put = gen6_ring_put_irq;
2950 ring->dispatch_execbuffer =
2951 gen6_ring_dispatch_execbuffer;
2952 if (i915_semaphore_is_enabled(dev)) {
2953 ring->semaphore.sync_to = gen6_ring_sync;
2954 ring->semaphore.signal = gen6_signal;
2955 ring->semaphore.mbox.wait[RCS] = MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_VR;
2956 ring->semaphore.mbox.wait[VCS] = MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_INVALID;
2957 ring->semaphore.mbox.wait[BCS] = MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_VB;
2958 ring->semaphore.mbox.wait[VECS] = MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_VVE;
2959 ring->semaphore.mbox.wait[VCS2] = MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_INVALID;
2960 ring->semaphore.mbox.signal[RCS] = GEN6_RVSYNC;
2961 ring->semaphore.mbox.signal[VCS] = GEN6_NOSYNC;
2962 ring->semaphore.mbox.signal[BCS] = GEN6_BVSYNC;
2963 ring->semaphore.mbox.signal[VECS] = GEN6_VEVSYNC;
2964 ring->semaphore.mbox.signal[VCS2] = GEN6_NOSYNC;
2965 }
2966 }
2967 } else {
2968 ring->mmio_base = BSD_RING_BASE;
2969 ring->flush = bsd_ring_flush;
2970 ring->add_request = i9xx_add_request;
2971 ring->get_seqno = ring_get_seqno;
2972 ring->set_seqno = ring_set_seqno;
2973 if (IS_GEN5(dev)) {
2974 ring->irq_enable_mask = ILK_BSD_USER_INTERRUPT;
2975 ring->irq_get = gen5_ring_get_irq;
2976 ring->irq_put = gen5_ring_put_irq;
2977 } else {
2978 ring->irq_enable_mask = I915_BSD_USER_INTERRUPT;
2979 ring->irq_get = i9xx_ring_get_irq;
2980 ring->irq_put = i9xx_ring_put_irq;
2981 }
2982 ring->dispatch_execbuffer = i965_dispatch_execbuffer;
2983 }
2984 ring->init_hw = init_ring_common;
2985
2986 return intel_init_ring_buffer(dev, ring);
2987}

3079int intel_init_vebox_ring_buffer(struct drm_device *dev)
3080{

3082 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = &dev_priv->ring[VECS];
3083
3084 ring->name = "video enhancement ring";
3085 ring->id = VECS;
3086
3087 ring->mmio_base = VEBOX_RING_BASE;
3088 ring->write_tail = ring_write_tail;
3089 ring->flush = gen6_ring_flush;
3090 ring->add_request = gen6_add_request;
3091 ring->get_seqno = gen6_ring_get_seqno;
3092 ring->set_seqno = ring_set_seqno;
3093
3094 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 8) {
3095 ring->irq_enable_mask =
3096 GT_RENDER_USER_INTERRUPT << GEN8_VECS_IRQ_SHIFT;
3097 ring->irq_get = gen8_ring_get_irq;
3098 ring->irq_put = gen8_ring_put_irq;
3099 ring->dispatch_execbuffer = gen8_ring_dispatch_execbuffer;
3100 if (i915_semaphore_is_enabled(dev)) {
3101 ring->semaphore.sync_to = gen8_ring_sync;
3102 ring->semaphore.signal = gen8_xcs_signal;
3103 GEN8_RING_SEMAPHORE_INIT;
3104 }
3105 } else {
3106 ring->irq_enable_mask = PM_VEBOX_USER_INTERRUPT;
3107 ring->irq_get = hsw_vebox_get_irq;
3108 ring->irq_put = hsw_vebox_put_irq;
3109 ring->dispatch_execbuffer = gen6_ring_dispatch_execbuffer;
3110 if (i915_semaphore_is_enabled(dev)) {
3111 ring->semaphore.sync_to = gen6_ring_sync;
3112 ring->semaphore.signal = gen6_signal;
3113 ring->semaphore.mbox.wait[RCS] = MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_VER;
3114 ring->semaphore.mbox.wait[VCS] = MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_VEV;
3115 ring->semaphore.mbox.wait[BCS] = MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_VEB;
3116 ring->semaphore.mbox.wait[VECS] = MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_INVALID;
3117 ring->semaphore.mbox.wait[VCS2] = MI_SEMAPHORE_SYNC_INVALID;
3118 ring->semaphore.mbox.signal[RCS] = GEN6_RVESYNC;
3119 ring->semaphore.mbox.signal[VCS] = GEN6_VVESYNC;
3120 ring->semaphore.mbox.signal[BCS] = GEN6_BVESYNC;
3121 ring->semaphore.mbox.signal[VECS] = GEN6_NOSYNC;
3122 ring->semaphore.mbox.signal[VCS2] = GEN6_NOSYNC;
3123 }
3124 }
3125 ring->init_hw = init_ring_common;
3126
3127 return intel_init_ring_buffer(dev, ring);
3128}
3129
3130int
3131intel_ring_flush_all_caches(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
3132{
3133 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
3134 int ret;
3135
3136 if (!ring->gpu_caches_dirty)
3137 return 0;
3138
3139 ret = ring->flush(req, 0, I915_GEM_GPU_DOMAINS);
3140 if (ret)
3141 return ret;
3142
3143 trace_i915_gem_ring_flush(req, 0, I915_GEM_GPU_DOMAINS);
3144
3145 ring->gpu_caches_dirty = false;
3146 return 0;
3147}
3148
3149int
3150intel_ring_invalidate_all_caches(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
3151{
3152 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
3153 uint32_t flush_domains;
3154 int ret;
3155
3156 flush_domains = 0;
3157 if (ring->gpu_caches_dirty)
3158 flush_domains = I915_GEM_GPU_DOMAINS;
3159
3160 ret = ring->flush(req, I915_GEM_GPU_DOMAINS, flush_domains);
3161 if (ret)
3162 return ret;
3163
3164 trace_i915_gem_ring_flush(req, I915_GEM_GPU_DOMAINS, flush_domains);
3165
3166 ring->gpu_caches_dirty = false;
3167 return 0;
3168}
3169
3170void
3171intel_stop_ring_buffer(struct intel_engine_cs *ring)
3172{
3173 int ret;
3174
3175 if (!intel_ring_initialized(ring))
3176 return;
3177
3178 ret = intel_ring_idle(ring);
3179 if (ret && !i915_reset_in_progress(&to_i915(ring->dev)->gpu_error))
3180 DRM_ERROR("failed to quiesce %s whilst cleaning up: %d\n",
3181 ring->name, ret);
3182
3183 stop_ring(ring);
3184}
